We are sorry you found us too expensive to use for your case.  As discussed in all consultations, there are many factors in determining the amount of money required for the retainer.  In some cases our retainer is increased due to the number of attorneys in the case before we are hired and sometimes the retainer is increased based on the complexity of the issues involved.  We wish you the best in your search for an attorney and as always wish all of our potential clients the best of luck with their case. We are sorry you found us too expensive to use for your case.  As discussed in all consultations, there are many factors in determining the amount of money required for the retainer.  In some cases our retainer is increased due to the number of attorneys in the case before we are hired and sometimes the retainer is increased based on the complexity of the issues involved.  We wish you the best in your search for an attorney and as always wish all of our potential clients the best of luck with their case. These are topics I learned the hard way and discovered not every lawyer who professes to be a military divorce expert is familiar with (for the record I can immediately name 3 locally). I did a lot of research during and after my divorce and can tell you that Michell has a firm grasp of the intricacies of military divorces (and he's even written a book further demonstrating his understanding). resp.text:
Dear Mr. Knowles,

I regret that you are unhappy with the outcome of your case, which was concluded when you indicated to the judge in open court that you understood and approved the agreement with your ex-wife for the entry of a judgment against your ex-wife, for which judgment your ex-wife has been paying since.  My records show that the judgment was entered and sent to you in January of 2017, some seven months prior to your review.  You have been notified immediately upon receipt of all payments made against the judgment, and you directed my office to hold those payments for you while you were in the process of moving.   Since that time, you have picked up all of the payments that your ex-wife has sent to this office.  Your ex-wife has your new address to send further payments directly to you.  I understand that you have also sought to garnish your ex-wife, and my paralegal communicated to you the cost of a consultation for further proceedings, which you declined to pay.  My paralegal did then  direct you to the appropriate clerk's office at the courthouse so that you could initiate further collection proceedings on your own if you chose to do so, even though your ex-wife has been making payments against the judgment.  I certainly appeared at the trial setting at which we obtained the judgment  against your ex-wife.  If you had wanted me to appear at any subsequent proceedings, you would have had to arrange for my further representation, which you did not.

name: Josh Kemp
text: I used Mr. Campbell for my divorce/child custody case. It was an uncontested divorce except for the fact that my ex wanted child support. Well, I didn't know any better, and I knew she wouldn't sign the papers if there was no child support so I agreed to give her what Mr. Campbell had come up with: $400. My ex originally wanted something like $650 per month so I looked at that as a win. Well, after talking with different people who have joint legal and physical custody like I do, they wonder why in the hell am I paying my ex ANY child support, since I have her week on and week off. And, after talking with two different lawyers, they wonder the same thing. The lawyer I have now told me if I'd taken our case to court, the judge would NOT have awarded child support to my ex. We will be going back to court needless to say, will definitely not be using Mr. Campbell who screwed me over.

resp.text: Dear Mr. Kemp, I appreciate the opportunity to have assisted with your case, but I do wish you had taken an opportunity to follow up with me about these concerns.  I did leave a message for you to call me concerning this matter, but I have not heard back from you.  I can address your concerns here.  As you might recall, you came to me to fix the agreement that you had tried to file on your own and that the court had rejected.  Without going into the details of the numbers involved with your case (which details are a matter of record) I can confidently say that you would likely have been ordered to pay around $400 per month in child support if you were awarded true joint physical custody after a trial.  If you had tried your case and been awarded joint legal custody, with your wife being awarded sole physical custody, you would have likely been ordered to pay around $650 per month.  Note that there is a difference between joint physical, versus joint legal, custody.  In Alabama, child support must still be calculated, and the judge still must state whether or not Rule 32 has been followed, even in joint physical custody situations.  This means that one party who makes significantly more than the other may still have to pay an amount of child support, and the method used to calculate $400 per month in your case is one that is accepted by the courts.  If two people make the same income, or have an agreement to deviate from guidelines, it is possible to have an order without child support.  Those conditions were not present in your situation.  The alternative would have been to pay me (or another lawyer) much more money to take your case to trial, and make an argument for custody and support, the result of which would not have been a certainty (and could result in less favorable terms of custody and having to pay more support than your agreement).  I'll be glad to explain this to the other persons that have provided feedback to you, as I fear that they must be either misinformed as to the facts or the law.  I am glad to have had the opportunity to assist you, and I will be happy to follow up with you concerning any questions that you have about this matter.

name: Hellbent 706
text: Great Bankruptcy attorney. I am a very satisfied client and I would highly recommend Mr. Neil to anyone based on my own experience to people needing to file bankruptcy or other legal matters like closing on a home etc.. I didn't know him before I walked into his office. I simply did a web search and he was one of several that came up in the search results. I had already called several Attorneys before I got to him but no one answered at those offices. Not even a receptionist. They all sent me to an answering machines. When I got to Mr. Neil's number he personally answered (that was a good sign) I told him I was nervous about filing bankruptcy due to my financial situation had taken a dive and now I make a lot less than I use to. Yes, I even tried consolidation and refinancing but even with a great credit score of 720 the banks still turned me down because my debt to income was too high which was weird because that's the whole point or refinancing is to get your interest rate cost down so you can keep paying. Plus the government said I owed them $10k in back taxes which forced me into Mr. Neils office. After talking with him, I wasn't nervous anymore. He explained everything so clearly and plainly that even a bird-brain could understand. I learned more in 30 minutes from Mr. Neil than I did from several weeks of internet research. I came in his office thinking (incorrectly) that I would be filing chapter 13 because I wanted to keep all my valuables requiring me to make 5 years worth of payments to the court. That sucks! I also incorrectly thought I didn't want to file chapter 7 because from my research, I incorrectly concluded they take most of your stuff of value and liquidate it and give the money to the creditors when you file chapter 7. Well, all that turned out to be wrong. Mr. Neil gave me great legal advice informing me that based on my situation, I could actually file chapter 7 and still keep everything including my Turbo Porsche and be completely discharged in 60 days and never have to make any payments to the court. I extended trust to him while hoping I wouldn't regret it and in the end he proved to be ligit. He saved me from 5 years of bankruptcy payments and I kept all my property. Why would anyone in my situation file chapter 13? Answer: They went to the wrong attorney!

name: Mike G

name: Alan Penn
text:
This guy cannot even process a simple home closing without complications.  While trying to send me some closing related documents via email, he failed to attach any documents to his outgoing email.  This did not occur just once; it happened multiple times!  In one instance, he actually attached someone's else documents by mistake!  (Wonder if there might be one or more Bar Associations, not to mention the other two parties whose documents I got, that would love to know about that?)
Not only did he have problems with the simplest things like attaching documents to an email, he also was very unprofessional in regards to processing documents on a timely basis.  This lack of professionalism actually resulted in a full week delay in closing; costing my elderly, handicapped parents additional closing and other costs that they would not have had to pay if closing had occurred when it was originally scheduled.
It's my suspicion that if you cannot properly and professionally handle a home closing, it’s just a reflection of your overall legal ability.  All I know is that if you want a hassle-free closing, don't let anybody stick you with this guy!  I would also be very leery about choosing him to represent me in regards to any legal matter!

resp.text: I'm sorry you had a bad experience,  The majority of my clients don't experience that as can be seen by prior positive reviews.  We were having email issues with attachments at that time and you were not the only victim of that issue. My office doesn't control technical issues experienced by Charter email.   Please bear in mind, that we were emailing documents to you for your convenience because you did not want to have to come to Decatur to close.  We were endeavoring to accommodate you and make your life more convenient.  Your closing did not go as well as we would have liked, but in human endeavors, sometimes things don't go as well as you might like.

text: Davis Varner was hired to represent a family member in court on a CRO Violation. When we spoke to Davis during the free consultation, he made you believe that the judge wouldn't sentence you to jail for a violation like that. We explained everything up front. He had all the information that was going to be brought up in court.  He acted like there was a possible of getting color code extended for few more months. He said I just don't see that judge sentencing you to jail. We had confidence in Davis that he would do a great job. I looked at the law firm website they had a section on color code violation. They acted like they had experience in handling these cases. Court day came and we didn't have a very good outcome. The worst thing possible happened. Davis didn't do anything to help his client. I wouldn't hire him again to represent anybody in a CRO Violation. You would be better off going with the court appointed attorney. Terrible experience!

name: EddyGordo21
text:
My mother has been dealing with this law firm for an abundance of years, and her experience has been far from stellar. This place moved three times since she has been their client, and they never informed her until she called them herself because they do not contact her. David, the person with whom she asks to speak, is constantly dodging her because he is always "out of the office" or "with another 'more important' client." I'm sure NONE of those "more important" clients have been as equanimous with them as she has.

David has apparently trained his staff to dodge her as well since she called them, and Alice refused to answer the phone (probably because of caller ID) but when I called, she answered the phone just to place us on hold to retrieve something so minuscule that it took less than 30 seconds to do...

Apparently this lawyer and his team care nothing about their clients--and dare I say clients of color... But this is the behavior that is typical of many businesses in the north central region of Alabama. Once the better business bureau is contacted, however, maybe they will change their tone.

If she had not contacted the actual courthouse to get her court date, she would not have even known of the impending court date. After calling these people several times, they refused to give her any of her case details.

So with regard to the other negative review this institution has received, I do NOT agree with the owner that "it is the work of a competitor." I have seen these practices first-hand, and I am far from a capital seeking adversary.

resp.text:
Because we don't recognize your name and you don't appear to be a client of our firm, based off your screen name, there's no way for us to address this issue without knowing the exact name of the client. We also do not have, nor have we ever had, any employees by the name of David or Alice. Are you sure you have the correct firm?

In relation to your comment about "people of color," approximately half of our clients are non-caucasion clients and are "people of color." We have dedicated this firm to representing clients who have been injured, oppressed, overlooked and not been treated fairly, regardless of their designation. Over the years, the lawyers and staff of our firm have also volunteered countless hours of their personal time participating in charities and outreach programs that benefit all segments of our community.

Although we're respectful of your opinion, the assertions you've made about the issue of race are reckless and inaccurate and thats clearly proven by 17 years of close relationships with people of all genders, races and socio-economic statuses that are repeat clients. Many people leaving reviews on this very site are "people of color" and would strongly disagree with your statement and actually take offense to it. Writing a negative review about a business that's never represented you is one thing but making baseless accusations of racial unfairness about people you don't know and who have spent their careers representing underprivileged segments of our state and communities is something else.

If your mother is dissatisfied with any service that any lawyer or staff member of our firm has ever provided, then please have your mother, personally, reach out immediately and ask for the head practice manager so that we can rectify this matter.

We take any client dis-satisfaction very seriously and want every client to be satisfied with our efforts. If your mother is, indeed, a past or current client, then any concerns your mother has will be given our complete attention and we will do our very best to address her concerns.

name: Melanie Daugherty
text: Josh O'Neal is the absolute worst attorney I have ever had. He refuses to return phone calls. He called me ONE TIME during my divorce, the day before the hearing. He never even bothered to send me the final divorce decree. I had no idea what my divorce papers said until his secretary emailed them to me, after the THIRD request. I know all of his secretaries because they are the only ones I could ever talk to. Half the time, they didn't return phone calls either. Halfway through the 'mediation' I got the distinct feeling that he was working for the other side. He obviously thinks he can make a living by gaining clients, screwing them over, and going on to the next victim. He must be too young and immature to grasp the concept that most people will need an attorney more than ONCE in their lifetime, and if he thinks he can be successful without the benefit of repeat clients, he is delusional. If he was the last attorney on earth, I would never hire him again. My divorce is final; I'm still missing half my belongings; he's promised me a refund twice and never delivered. On top of that, he suggested we file a contempt motion because of the fact that I was not given all the belongings I was entitled to. He didn't mention at the time that he planned on charging me an additional $1500 to do what I'd already paid him to do. In my opinion, the reason all his pictures on FB look like gangster photos is because he is a crook. He will stand there and 'listen' to you, but he is just pretending to hear you. You'd have more luck talking to a brick wall. Plus the brick wall might return your calls. I read a bad review of his, and I should have heeded it. If you need a great attorney, contact Michael Haynes.

text: Where do I start?! Kris is a GAMECHANGER for Family Law. She is organized, responsive, caring, and more importantly...she gets results! I am so grateful to have met her. She is someone that you can tell your issue to once and she knows what you are thinking and how to fix it before you do. Nobody ever wants to go to court and I was a nervous wreck even though I was the one that filed. Kris was so compassionate, told me to relax...that she's got it and she was right. She will have your back! To achieve that level of trust that quickly when dealing with your family is priceless to me. I will forever be so grateful to have met her. Kris Sexton is definitely who you need to hire for custody issues, etc. Hopefully I will not need her again...but she offered to be on stand by if I needed anything else. What a great lawyer!

name: Jerica Anthony
text:
I called Next Step Family Law after hearing many friends talk about how good they are. I’m SO happy I did! With only two days until court I went in for a consultation with Coby Boswell. From the time I walked in the door, they were very welcoming and understanding. I felt better immediately after the consultation and decided to go with them.
I am so grateful I did.
Mr Boswell and his team managed to get all of my scattered information together and build my case for me. They would call to check in and see how things were going. I felt like I had a support group outside of my support group.
I was having a difficult time with everything before I had talked to Mr Boswell. He reassured me that everything was going to be fine and it was.
Mr Boswell and Cheryl did an amazing job.
We had discussed what I wanted to come from this custody case and they stood strong and made sure that’s exactly what I got.
If you need an attorney for family law I highly recommend Next step family law!!!!! This team of people are hardworking and dedicated individuals. I wouldn’t change my decision if I could. I want to say thank you to Next Step for working with me on such short notice. Thank you for standing by me and getting the job done. I’m truly blessed to have had a great team stand by me through this hard time. Definitely Five Stars!!!

text: I dont typically post reviews, but I understand the difficulty finding good legal representation. Hopefully this review will help others in narrowing their search for legal representation. My divorce was difficult at best, but Ed was always a calming force, was honest with his feedback, and fought hard for my rights. Ed is not your "typical" attorney. I was unfortunately involved with other attorneys during this process, that were not employed at Merrill law firm. I quickly learned a lesson in law. In my experience a lot of attorneys are concerned first and foremost with money, and concerned secondary with actually dealing with and helping the person behind their paycheck. I never felt this way with Ed Merrell or anyone else at Merrell law firm. Ed has a passion for actually helping his clients and a genuine/honest approach to his job. If you want honest, hard-working, knowledgeable, representation, go with Merrell.

name: April Ray
text:
I am going through a nasty divorce. I wanted Mr. Merrell to rep. Me but he pushed me off on Mrs. Harrison. I paid $1000 for her to come to my Pendente Lite court appearance. I had never saw her. She asked me for a document and disappeared for a while. She came and got me around the side hall on another wooden bench after back surgery. I paid another $500 to send the answer to the Decree. Never got to speak to her again. I sent emails and got a rude email saying "I can not check emails all day. You aren't my only case.
I then got a letter from Ed which was asking for $5000 immediately to cover the remainder of the case. I sent Mrs. Harrison an email that I had something that could shut down the case. I got a rude email that told me they would not speak to me or return an email till I paid $460 or so now and then the remainder of $5000. That was the last straw. I got them to send me an invoice for ONLY what was behind. I WILL NEVER SUGGEST THEM. Now with no lawyer searching for another I am going to lose my battle to keep my son. It's all about the $$$. I'm paying the deficit, getting my stuff and taking it to another attorney.

text: I hired Mr. Merrell to represent me in an emergency hearing to try and get custody of my grand child and keep her from being okaced in foster care. There were no allegations of abuse or neglect and it should have been an easy case to win. I paid a $1000,00 retainer fee. He sent another attorney Ms. Baulder and she was totally incompetent. She told me that I could not enter the court room because I was not a party to the case but the child's mother was present and wanted me to go in with her and I had every right to do that but Ms.Baulder refused and just sat at the table and did nothing. She told me that a half day at court would cost $650.00. I contacted Mr. Merrill and asked for my money back he would not even refund me the $350.00 that was left after paying her the $650.00 for doing nothing. I had paid him $1030.00 and he sent me a check for $15.00. Do not trust this law firm.,

name: Wes Christie
text: They do great work!! Helpful, understanding and puts your mind at ease

name: Linda Ponziano
text: I first met April Bauder at legal aid in Birmingham. I took my daughter with me to be my other "eyes and ears" as I suffer from anxiety and panic disorders, and needed legal advice as my husband was divorcing me, for the 4th time and I had no money to hire an attorney. April was kind and compassionate and patient. I started off my divorce without a lawyer, as the husband made me all kind of promises, and I believed him. You know the saying " fool me once, shame on you, fool me 7639 times.....", well..... things got ugly, and I saved my quarters, dimes, and nickles, worked harder, and on Jan 23, 2018 I hired Miss April Bauder. Why? You don't  fake kindness, that is something  you are taught. You don't fake compassion, that is something you feel. People with handicaps are treated "different", and April has never treated me different. She ALWAYS returns my calls, and last, her laughter! She has this infectious,  contagious  BEAUTIFUL laughter!!!!  The last few months have been sorrowful, painful, and soooo much hurt. I could cry til the sun goes down, April calls me and I giggle, and giggle and giggle! Proverbs 17:22 "a cheerful heart is good medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones." (NIV)  AND Leah Thomas? Well, somewhere is a storage unit, there is a sparkling little tiara, for her, and she will be the guest of honor at my next pool party! Thank you, thank you thank you, April. If it wasn't for your volunteer work, I would of never found you. Grateful  for the Merrell Law Firm, and what it produces out of it's  people, for people like me who are struggling.... Linda Lee Ponziano Bradford

text: Samantha was our attorney in 2012 and again in 2014. We only regret that we did not find her sooner! Like I said, wish we would have found her sooner. If there is a way, Samantha will find it! God knows it wasn't easy for her. Thank you once again, Samantha!

text: I was a desperate man and signed the worst divorce agreement ever written in exchange for a chance to save my marriage. My private investigator recommended I hire a strong female divorce attorney to fight back (because lets face it,  generally speaking, when it comes to a fight - women are often craftier and stronger than men).  He told me to call Samantha Rush.  So I did.  The process was unpleasant and took more time and money than I liked, but well worth it.  Samantha successfully freed me from a life sentence of unfair financial abuse and other unreasonable obligations.  Thank you Samantha.  I now have my freedom and a second chance at life and true  happiness.  I am blessed.  Plus, if things don't go perfectly from here on out, I'm not worried because I know Samantha is always just a phone call away.

text: I hired Lloyd & Hogan for a personal injury after being hit by a drunk driver. The folks I dealt with failed to honor their word. Do not take anything said in conversation as truth. Have ALL correspondence done in writing. Agreements we made over the phone were later denied. They agreed to an even split because they could not get more or refused to continue the case. Also, they continually urged me to settle the case for less than what I should have received. I am left with nerve damage in my neck, which causes tremmors in my right hand. The fiirm made out well.

name: Anon 23
text: If possible, I'd give this firm negative stars. I STRONGLY advise you choose a different firm to represent you. They are a very poor excuse for attorney's. They don't care about you as a person or a case and will not devote the attention deserved. I talked to other lawyers in hopes to fire the one I had in this firm and regret every single day for not doing it. The small cost I would have had to pay to switch lawyers at the point I was at in my case would have been worth it because the rest of my life is affected due to the lack of concern and legal advice provided. If I could keep even one person from having been poorly represented by these people it would be worth it. Don't make the mistake I made. Hire Alexander Shunnarah before you throw your case away with Lloyd and Hogan.

resp.text: Anon 23, are sorry that you did not have a good experience with our firm. We have checked our records and do not see any files under your name, but we appreciate you bringing this experience to our attention. If you are willing, please contact us at 205-969-6235 so we can work towards a resolution. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Tracy Causey
text:
DO NOT USE THIS FIRM!!!!

My brother hired Lloyd and Hogan in Birmingham for help with his disability.   He can never talk to anyone and leaving a message is a joke!  His wife has done all the leg work on this case.  He has been diagnosed with Stage 4 Cancer and when his wife finally spoke with his case worker, she was told his court date for February 2019 could not be moved up!!!  OMG...praying he makes it to February.
DO NOT USE THIS FIRM!!!!!

resp.text: Ms. Causey, I am sorry that you have these feelings, but following the receipt of your review we have spoken with your brother and his wife, who we actually represent, and they do not share your feelings. I suggest you speak with them, and if they have any issues they are of course welcome to contact us to discuss. However, according to our clients, they are very satisfied with our services, as well as the timeliness of services provided and the work ethic of all involved in the handling of their case.

They represented my children for an airbag deployment incident that happened at an impound lot which got a settlement for my kids really think it should have been more and I feel they knew they could get an easy win for them but when it came to me they did not want to bother with the hassle of actually having to fight a case that was a little more difficult because the impound lot owner in Calhoun County that committed the incident by slamming my driver door which deployed airbag on me and my kids which also totaled out my truck making me a victim as well there's no reason why I should be compensated as well.
However since the impound owner works with the Calhoun County courthouses and Sheriff's the magistrates at Calhoun County Courthouse would not let me swear a warrant on the owner of the impound lot but then all of a sudden after getting a small claims paperwork to file against them I suddenly have a warrant for assault charges when I never assaulted anybody court systems there would not even allow me to call my Witnesses that would prove that he is a liar and proved that the Calhoun County Court System is unjust but since supposedly I got in a fight with the owner which I never did I only was defending myself and never threw any punches only foul language however they would not represent me for the case

name: Ricky Canady
text: I cannot express enough the gratitude and appreciation I have for both Jo Anna and Lynn. After a long, grueling divorce process I can honestly say that Jo Anna and Lynn were there for me every step of the way. They are very direct and give you the facts so leave your feelings at the door because you might have to hear some things you don't want to hear. However, they are very empathetic and supportive. Example: During mediation it started out very rough. Jo Anna kept it real with me and told me the pros and cons with going to court. One of the many things I love about her though, is once I said that I didn't care about all of that let's go to war, she busted out her notebook and said lets got to war then!  She started prepping for court right in the middle of mediation but thankfully my case was able to settle without having to step inside a courtroom. My ultimate goal was to get split time with my kids due to my ex keeping them away from me amongst other things and as expected that's exactly what I got. I can't speak for anyone else, but I promise you Jo Anna and Lynn are the two people you want in your corner. Definitely using them again when the time comes again. Thank you!

name: Kristi Parrish
text: This was the worst attorney I have ever had so called “represent me”! Mrs. Parker only cares about the father’s roll in custody cases, no matter which side she represents!! If you need to keep your child safe then this is definitely not the attorney for you! She talks a huge game about court but will take you to mediation and tell you this is all the courts will do for you! She is a joke! Her receptionist, Lynn, is a nightmare! She lies almost as much as my ex husband! I will be re-evaluating my case in another court of law. Good luck getting her to respond after you hire her, too. They will go to any length to collect your money then not even care if you get child support! There are so many other attorney’s out there that care about their clients! Save your money!

resp.text:
Dear Kristi,

I know going through a divorce can be emotionally devastating. I hope one day you find peace and you will be able to reflect on your final order awarding you sole physical custody as well as child support and realize just how well things turned out for you. I read your review with great confusion as it holds a multitude of misstated facts, but nonetheless it was a pleasure representing you. I wish you nothing but happiness in the future.

text: Very let down, even after they would be causing trauma to my granddaughter, and her counselor report said she's to young for video visits, she recommended that they be allowed.

name: Juan RiveraMarrero
text:
I will forever be grateful to Mrs. Parker. She helped me on a custody battle and thanks to her I now have more time with my daughter and more!! She was always upfront and always gave me her most honest advice. We didn't have to go to court because we settle during mediation thanks to her and her advice. Even when i thought some things were my only option she always fought for me and told me "No Juan that's not your only option, we're not going to agree with that and if we have to go to court then we will go to court" That gave me so much confidence and we ended up getting more than what we asked for. THANK YOU Mrs. Parker.

Her assistant Mrs. Lynn Allen was also great, professional and very helpful!

If I ever need any other legal advice, Mrs. Parker will always be my first choice!!!

"Si Se Puede"

name: Gabriela Danielson
text: They sat on my paperwork for 30 days before filing it to the court. Didn’t even send me an email to inform me that they still didn’t file it due to them not having internet access. $100 consultation, $1,500 for an uncontested divorce and court filing fee. Only to have to still just begin the 30 day wait period after already waiting 30 days from the moment we both signed and notarized the paperwork.

resp.text:
Dear Gabriela,

As you know, our office caught on fire and we were unable to promptly file until we were relocated to our temporary office space. I sincerely apologize for any distress this delay has caused you. I can assure you that if not for the fire that made my office inoperable, your paperwork would have been filed the same day.

Best regards,
Jo Anna Parker

name: Philip Smitley
text: When I first met Mrs. Parker, at the end of our consultation her words were, "You'll be fine". From the time I filed to the final order her words continued to echo in my head and calmed my nerves during the unnecessary delays and a stressful trial, caused by the other party. Lynn Allen, her assistant, is the best. Lynn is quick to respond to every question and supported the preparation process. In trial, Mrs. Parker was professional and prepared. She presented herself with authority and confidence. When the final order came, circumstances held true to her words, I'm fine. For me, she was the best choice and I highly recommend her for your domestic legal needs.

name: Sherry Marie
text: I highly recommend JoAnna! She fought hard for a very pleasing outcome for me. She is very knowledgeable and to the point. She is absolutely amazing. Her assistant, Ms. Lynn is also very knowledgeable was always willing to take my call and help me every step of the way. I owe my future to these two magnificent ladies.

name: lakadria minter
text: Going into this divorce I was very scared and didn't have any knowledge about anything. The woman told me that I would need an appointment for a consultation, she charges $250 an hour, and it would take up to two hours to go over the paperwork for a contested divorce. I'm not doing a contested divorce, money isn't a problem for me, and her attitude chased my business elsewhere.  Got the feeling they care more about money, than helping people.

resp.text:
Dear Lorri,
Although you were not a client and we never met, I am sorry you were not satisfied with the answers my assistant provided to you in the few seconds she was given the opportunity to do so over the phone. I can assure you our number one priority is our clients and their best interests and we pride ourselves on their satisfaction.

Through this 5 month battle, she stood by her word, and was always there when I needed her- almost instantly. As a mother I can say just the thought of losing your children is enough to break your heart. She stopped that from happening, for me. Patrick tends to give you his utmost attention and will reach out to you immediately if he senses you are feeling disappointed with the legal process. I recommend him to anyone who is thinking of divorce and is worried about child custody.

name: Lois Chandler Cahalane
text: She was an awful attorney that we paid $2,000 for my case and this was my very first time being in any kind of trouble and I was 19 years old at the time and could of qualified for youthful offender. I of course had no idea about this youthful offender plea I could of then qualified for until years later .But this being  my first time in trouble I was completely naive about the justice system and was putting my faith in my paid for attorney Ali Garrett assuming she knew what she was doing more than myself of course since I'm just a massage therapist . She ended up putting me through pretrial diversion and I had probation and served jail time and now those misdemeanors are on my record forever. When all she had to do was plead youthful offender then I would at least have the chance to have them ex sponged off my record and even a lawyer fresh out of school would of done that! I can't believe I paid $2000 for her horrible services. I would of been better off representing myself still even without any knowledge of the law.

resp.text: I'm sorry you were unhappy with my services.  I wish you had told ME you were unhappy instead of leaving me a bad review months later on Google. Pretrial diversion is a better deal than Youthful Offender because if you complete it successfully your charges are DISMISSED instead of being convicted of violating the Youthful Offender Act.  I wish you the best of luck in the future.

name: Michele Harris
text: My experience with Ali Garrett was and is the best that one could hope for in a child custody case. She is not only very knowledgeable about the law but she is also very caring and a good Christian woman. She has prayed for and with me many times and we would not have custody of our boys if not for her hard work and tenacity. She is honest and will tell you straight up if what you want or your expectations are valid and within the law. She will not sugarcoat things just to get a client. She is smart and a fighter for children's rights. I highly recommend her her to anyone.

Every time I would call no answer or It was her secretary and she was rude also she almost acted as if Im some horrible person she was no help in court kind of slap in the face but thanks for freely taking my money I would have spent on someone who would have actually been of help and not been on the side with the father ...enough said here so many more things I could say but its not worth it thanks for making me feel like the worst mother in the world !!!!!

name: Chase Piper
text:
Out of the three attorneys I had on this   Particular case Ali was the only one to get things moving. 1st atty I could never get a hold of second atty just up and quit their Lawfirm and leaving me with my hands in the air.

After all the evidence I have showing proof of the lies it never made it to trial... from what I’ve heard that’s a financial blessing. but with that being done.so much was over looked.

so I don’t blame Ali for that I feel like that’s just how family court is. That’s how they are taught. get them in the door  and whatever paper gets thrown at you make them sign it.

And after you sign papers even if the other person is lying about information (under oath) and you have proof of that lie “It doesn’t matter judges do not go back on orders”  “you signed it and now you have to deal with it” “ take the chip off your shoulder”

So what I’ve learned from this is don’t sign anything without getting attorneys to prove what the other party is saying is true.

In one particular instance I made the mistake of trusting what Ali said was true even though I told her there’s no way that’s possible.

I signed the paper(s) went home and double checked things to find out the truth and found that the other party was indeed taking an extra *K from me.

I sent her an email showing her my findings and asked if she needed more proof I would be glad to give her copies of bank statements.

I had asked other questions as well that did not get answered. It’s been over a week since that email I guess since I’ve already paid her my questions aren’t important?

I gave ali  3 stars for helping me get what I was asking for.  “For the most part” and getting things in motion.

But failing to prove the other parties statements and having me sign papers that  inevitably put me out of more money.

Sign here, sign here , next client

resp.text: I can not fully reply due to attorney client privilege but I wish you the best of luck in the future!

5 Stars. 2 Thumbs Up. Standing Ovation.(Review is worth reading) Long story short, Randall took our case at the last minute. My wife and I are out of Amarillo,TX fighting for visition rights/child custody in a case there in Alabama near Pell City. Randall worked with us financially because travel cost to and from court, time out of work and hotel expenses. Randall pleaded with the judge for us not having to go to court when not necessary because of travel distance from Amarillo. Instead, Randall represented us everytime and was Our Voice in court when we weren't present. Every time after a court hearing, more and more worked in our favor. He convinced the judge if one more slip up from my wife's ex then our daughter (my step daughter) would come back home to Amarillo,Texas on a one way ticket permanently. Better yet, our daughter and her father moved back to Texas in fear of losing custody. Randall was outstanding and Mary(his assistant) was So Extremely Friendly. Both Down to Earth! Is he recommended? With No Doubt! A True Blessing!
Randall, Thank You!

text:
I would give this office a ZERO if I could!!
My ex and I went into an UNCONTESTED adoption and this was starting in Aug 18’ and it finally went to court middle of Dec 18’. The incompetence, unresponsive, lack of follow through and  disrespectful asstistant and lawyer are the issues. I received attitude that was unjustified when I called for my updates when they said they would call. Due to my ex paying for said adoption they used profanity at me and said we will speak to our client, do not call us anymore! That was ridiculously unprofessional!  I have been nothing but truly helpful and the only time I got true updates was when I went in person! I gave 99.9%of all documents required. Any update you ask for or they offer will not happen.

My child was born out of state and we are trying to get them to send the necessary papers out to get a new birth certificate issued and I’ve gotten the biggest run around! They even told me to do it myself when they were paid to do this service! I respectfully stated that they had from August to get this sorted and asked why it was taking so long and that’s where the assistant “Toni” used profanity then assumed to go onto a rant and hung up on me because I asked a simple question..if that shouldn’t throw a flag idk what would. They point blame and don’t take responsibility for their shortcomings and bill for service that shouldn’t have to happen! DHR lost the papers...”oh I’m not sure when I can get to it” ...they are a joke! When the court hearing happened they didn’t even have all the papers necessary even though we showed up prepared! And getting our copies of said papers took even longer! “Oh he hasn’t checked the box”
Their office is legit across the street from the court house! Please I urge anyone who might stumble upon this DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME and MONEY with this poor excuse of a legal office! I’ll be happy to answer any and all questions y’all have :) please make good choices when selecting a good lawyer!

text:
I required legal council and set forth into what was a rather exhaustive investigation of my local options. In doing so, I stumbled upon Mr. Monk’s website, and being impressed with what I learned of his credentials and experience, I gave him a call. Mr. Monk met me right away—on a Saturday, during a thunderstorm no less—for the sake of my convenience alone. He was abundantly knowledgeable and proficient, guiding me through each step of what otherwise would have been a rather taxing process.
I typically do not bother to leave reviews for services; however, this was a case that warranted exception. Such was the exceptional professionalism of the man. To those of you in need of legal council: look no further. Place your confidence in Mr. Monk’s exceedingly capable hands.

name: Hanna Patterson
text:
Had no complaints at first. Not from Alabama, never been in trouble. Never needed an attorney. Got a “drug paraphernalia” charge for a grinder/pipe 🙄 coming home from Florida vacay. They called back in a timely manner, lowered the fee of one bc we were a “package deal” in which I very appreciate HOWEVER he changed my “defendents statement” after we had already signed. Including information that was false and incorrect. He was a solid 30 minutes late for court. So after having falsified court documents, I called him to get them changed or corrected and his response was that the DA needed what the paraphernalia was so “maybe he should have ran it by us”, it didn’t matter, he couldn’t do anything, and the judge already signed off on it. Then upon exiting the court offered to walk us out just to ask for a review on Google. He was pretty easy to talk to, which was the only thing I had to really say until I saw my falsified documents.

‼️UPDATE‼️: MISUNDERSTANDING WAS CORRECTED AND BRIAN MADE SURE THE DOCUMENTS WERE CORRECTED ON BOTH ENDS AND CONTACTED ME IMMEDIATELY WITH FILED/APPROVED CORRECTIONS. I highly recommend using his services! ‼️UPDATE‼️

resp.text: Thank you Hanna. I assure you I had no intent to falsify anything. It was an honest mistake and I’m happy I could help get everything straightened out for you. Best wishes!

name: Frank Page
text: In 2012 Mr Dasinger was court appointed to me in a criminal case, I never once met with him,spoke to him, nothing until my court date. I wrote many letters, and my family made many calls to no response. The day of court, he had no idea who I was or anything about my case. All he had to say was the state is sending you to prison and to accept it cause that was my only option. I was young, scared, and had no idea what to do. He on the other hand, played on fb, laughed it up with the states attorney, and my victim. My first and only felony, poss of forged instrument, two checks for less than $50, got me 3 yrs. I got more help from the inmates sitting next to me that day than I got from him. He did NOTHING in my deffense. I do honestly believe the outcome would have been less severe if I had paid him cash, or if I had went with a diffrent lawyer. It has been many years and I do hope he has grown as a lawyer and person since then, but I would not recommend him.

resp.text: Unfortunately, when I held a contract with the State of Alabama as an appointed attorney, I did not have the time to meet with all of the 100+ new clients that I was appointed to represent each month. The numbers were simply overwhelming and impossible to keep up with.  I have not handled court appointed work since 2013 because I wanted to be able to give more personal attention to all of my clients, which I am now able to do.  I'm deeply sorry that I couldn't have helped you more Frank.  I hope all is going well and I wish you a prosperous 2019.

It was as long road, but i know have a successful business of my own and, am and was  , able to raise 3 beautiful young ladies whom im very proud of. name: Lewis McCluer
text: I'm involved in a landlord-tenant dispute and realized I was over my head and needed help. I contacted the Powell Law Firm and got a consultation with Thomas that day. He was very attentive and professional and let me know my options in plain, no nonsense terms. He also let me know that the firm was always available should the matter get to the point that representation became necessary. When I had further questions as the situation progressed, I called back, but was unable to reach Thomas immediately, as he was in court that day. I left a message with their front desk,  and received a call back from Melvin later that day as Thomas was still in court. He listened intently and further advised me as what I needed to do, and even returned another call in regards to my issue. Both Thomas and Melvin were extremely helpful in what was to me new territory as I had never been in a situation like this before. They stood ready to assist any way they could to include retaining their services should the need arise. As a retired Marine with 26 years service I know professionalism when I see it. Hope I don't need to retain an attorney for this current situation but I have full confidence in them should that need arise. I highly recommend that you contact them in the event you fell you may need the services of an attorney/

I'm pretty sure that conversation should not have been discussed in front of a potential client. As I am sitting there explaining to Mr. Thomas why I am there seeking hes services he was more interested in picking the sores on his leg then paying any attention to anything i had to say, and while he was showing me the bruises from his recent jet ski accident all he could tell me was to seek an attorney immediately. I believe that's what I am here. What he ment was i needed a court appointed attorney because I could not afford him. So with Very unprofessional! My family has dealt with Powell Law firm for many years my aunt has know Mr. Thomas sence hes graduation year in 07. They have been wonderful people always willing to help with a smile. till now. So with no help from Mr. Thomas all I can do now is sit back and hope a friend doesn't pass away in lockup because she has a rare condition that causes her to have seizures. name: Tina Hanke
text: She will steal your money and never even show up for court. I was not the client, she made that perfectly clear but she dropped my son for NO REASON AT ALL after he paid her $4800

resp.text: Ms Hanke, was not the client. Her adult son was a client. She has made false allegations. It is important to know that when one who is not a client, posts on a review, it is not based on the complete occurrences of the representation as she was not the client and was not privy to all the information. In addition, when she did not get all the information she wanted about the case--attorney client privilege exists to protect the client--she asserted defamatory statements in a public forum. When the client is noncompliant, or is unwilling to pursue certain avenues of a case, the mother of an adult child becomes irritated by outcomes rather than considering the reason for the outcomes. Perhaps one should remember who the client is and that Mom's and Dad's can't make adult children act in a manner for which they want despite the desire to pay for representation. Paying for representation does not guarantee results and does not grant the person paying free access to the information in a case.

name: Lori Norris
text:
Hi, I’m Lori Norris. My brother, Jeremy Jerry  was charged with capitol murder charges. Dani V. Bone and Sam Bone Attorneys took his case. They are father and son.
Right from the start they were friendly and professional. They got my brother to be evaluated at Taylor Hardin Secured Medical Center. That is a much nicer place with someone with a mental illness. You got to visit for 2 hrs on the weekends in person. He was going to stay there til his trial. He had several competency hearings. He wasn’t competent. His trial was set for May. We were all grieving and sad. I love my brother no matter what. Then in April I got a call his trial was canceled. He failed his last competency test. I was happy. My brother Jeremy Jerry was going to live in a group home for the rest of his life. With competency hearings every 6 months. He could live somewhat of a life.♥️🙏

If you didn’t read anything else. Dani V. and Sam Bone are great, kind and friendly attorneys. They are professional and work hard to get the job done. They are kind and friendly but they also kick butt! I never thought this would be possible! I am grateful for them the rest of my life. Thank you Dani V. Bone and Sam Bone. I will come to you if I need an attorney in the future for sure.

Lori Norris

name: Kathy Johnson
text: Divorce is HARD no matter if you want it or not, I don't wish it on anyone. When I was faced with mine in 2019, I was referred to Dani Bone through a coworker and friend that I trusted. I initially hired Dani because I heard he was the very best and he would fight for me. I called and even though they were extremely busy, they saw me right away. After hearing my situation, Dani was honest with me and said, "You need Sam. " My case was very complicated having both personal and business issues, assets and properties to divide, custody and other court issues . Sam took it as a challenge. He stayed with me and guided me through the whole divorce process. It was not easy, it was extremely tough but Sam knew how to handle every situation that came up. When going through a 2 yr battle, you need to know and  feel confident that your attorney has your back and has your best interest at heart. I emotionally fell apart many times and he helped me to learn to stand up for myself and it made me a stronger person through this process. All I wanted was what was fair- he got me exactly what I asked for! I was extremly pleased with services of Sam, Dani and their dedicated and caring staff. Amanda, Fredrick and Osha were just wonderful to work with. The whole staff made me feel comfortable and at ease through a very uncomfortable life circumstance.  While the other party had 5 attorneys through the process , I had one.  I only needed the one team- I had The Best with Sam & Dani Bone. Sam was honest, upfront, bold and encouraging. He never had to be ugly or raise his voice in court or trial and never once belittled anyone. I recall him saying, "It doesn't have to be ugly". Being a Christian, a professional, a self employed woman, a Realtor and a mother of 2, this was imperative to me. Sam treated both parties with total RESPECT always . That was very important to me.  I did my part and provided the true facts, evidence and proof- he did his part and presented my case with true professionalism , Integrity and no one was disrespected in the process. I would 💯 percent recommend Sam & Dani Bone if you want to be represented by someone who will always have your back and is not afraid to fight for your best interest. Thank you Sam, Dani, and your amazing team. If I ever need attorney services in the future , I will use you again and will highly recommend you to anyone that I know. You Rock!

name: Bernadette Wineman
text:
Earlier this year, I found myself in need of a divorce attorney when my ex petitioned to modify our final judgment. I no longer lived in Alabama and was unsure of where to turn for legal advice. After consulting with Mr. Sam Bone, it was clear that he had a deep understanding of law and how it applied to my particular situation.

Many attorneys will promise the moon, without being able to deliver a star. Sam will be honest about your case, talk with you about the possibilities, and develop a plan to protect your best interests. Phone calls/emails are answered promptly and you are made aware of appointments and court actions. Even though my case was regular family law issues, it was treated as a priority.

When emotions run high and people play dirty, you need an attorney that will keep you focused. It was nothing short of a blessing to have Sam’s counsel during this time. Sam will listen and use what will benefit your case most, helping you to make the best decisions.

Through my experience, I learned that Sam is wise beyond his years and holds a unique combination of qualities that make him an excellent attorney. He is a younger lawyer in comparison to many of the veterans in the area, but his expertise speaks through shrewd discernment, both in and outside the courtroom.

In retrospect, I know that employing a professional, well-versed attorney who gave honest legal advice was a valuable asset to me. My case only involved family law, but I would recommend Sam Bone in every area that he practices. My children and I are thankful for the Bone Law Firm.

I was in bad shape recovering from cancer and kidney failure when I was arrested.  They made me feel like I had nothing to worry about. He will go out of his way to help and set up a payment arrangement for you.  I could not have had a better Gadsden criminal lawyer.  Sam knows the laws.  Everytime I see him he tells me he is proud for me to see how well I am doing.  I am going for my degree in psychology and further to a doctrine. text: Words can not express how much of a pleasure it was working with Adrian at a time when my world was upside down. He is honestly the type guy I would enjoy having a beer with if I hadn't ever met him under the previously mentioned circumstances. Adrian took a process that seemed so monstrous and intimidating from my perspective, and made it dare I say enjoyable. If you are doing your research on a fantastic attorney to hire, and you have discovered Adrian, do yourself a favor and save a ton of headache.... Hire Adrian!

text: Jim has been my attorney since 2015 and has been a huge asset to not only my family but to our business as well. I cannot say enough about him and his abilities. He was referred to me by another attorney which in itself speaks volumes. Pino & Associates will be our law firm for all our business and personal needs!

name: Tara Davenport
text:
In December 2015 Jim Pino was referred to me by a family friend, also an attorney and who’s advice and opinion matter greatly to me.

I needed an attorney who would fight for me. To help and advise me with a divorce after 23 years of marriage. I knew going into it that it wasn’t going to be anywhere close to pretty, much less easy for a multitude of reasons. But I also knew that I had “hit my wall” and it was necessary. I also knew that I was going to have to have an attorney that would work with me, not just for me. I had been married since I was 21.... nothing about anything was easy and I was terrified about everything.

And that’s exactly what Jim did for me.

Jim and his amazing staff helped me through one of the hardest times of my life and helped me find myself again.

I would and do, recommend Jim Pino & Associates to any and everyone who asks.

Thank you Jim and thank you to your awesome staff!!

name: Gordon Madden
text: There is not enough space to share my experience with Jim and the entire staff. They have worked with me for over a decade (11) years. Almost daily, many nights, weekends even when they've been on vacation. Never once failing to jump up to the emergency, or simply to make sure my son was protected. Because of Jim and his family, staff and associates, I have been given the opportunity to have a wonderful relationship with my little boy. He's stood in my defense against 17 different lawyers, sometimes 5 against 1. His son has stood with me as well. We've had multiple trials, most recently he postponed major surgery and suffered through a 4 day trial. Agonizing in Pain against 4 very reputable lawyers. Not to mention, he did this for 1/5 of the money the other guys were being paid. He did it because he cares and felt that it was in my son's best interest and we'll being. Just today, our order was issued. Once again, his hard work and character and one of a kind skill prevailed. I still have sole custody and I am assured a meaningful relationship with the most important thing in my life. I can never repay Jim for his decade long dedication to making sure we're protected. If you need help, a brief visit with him will reveal the true character and heart he puts into making sure justice prevails. My name is Gordon Madden and I would be happy to share my story with you.

Had to chase him down once we realized how wrong he was.  My company paid him in March.  It is now October and still not done.  I have to call him every time.  So far have called him 4 times this week with no response.  Horrible lawyer.  Wouldn't use him ever again!  It shows how attention to detail he is.  Google still has him in Hoover.  He moved downtown at least 6 months ago, but he has no clue!!!

name: Aneesh Chand
text: Highly unethical attorney. We chose Tim since he was  a member of our legal plan to represent us in a civil case. After telling us that the plan would not cover our case, we paid Tim a $2500 retainer. During this time Tim would be proactive and mail us copies of whatever documents he would send or file with the courts. I looked over our legal plan and found that his charges should have, in fact, been covered by our plan.Our legal plan's counse determined that this was so and advised Tim of the same. Since being notified that his time would be covered by the plan and  to not use my retainer for covered charges, I stopped getting any correspondence from his office. No copies of any documents,  no phone calls, no more updates, nothing. Tim never even told us that there was a hearing for summary judgement. The  only reason we found out was from a copy of the order from the  court, itself.  After the hearing, we found out that Tim didn't even argue our case as we had discussed. We eventually lost our case. Tim didn't even bother to notify us until over a week later. When asked about our options, Tim determined that he no longer wanted to represent us and referred us to another attorney who wouldn't even return our calls. When asked about the refund of the $2500 retainer, Tim put us off for over 6 weeks until he finally acknowledged he was trying to "come up" with the money. Our legal plan counsel had also been contacting him to return our retainer without further delay. Throughout this time and during our case Tim would never initiate contact with us. We had to initiate contact with him. Even then, it would take anywhere from a week and a half to a month before he would respond.  Tim eventually decided after 46 days that he was no longer going to refund our money despite knowing that his charges were covered by our plan. I have yet to get a breakdown of how my retainer was spent, much less anything else. I would never refer him to anyone. Now he is running for circuit court judge. If Tim is representative of our judicial and legal system, then we, as citizens, have very little when it comes to faith in our legal system.

name: Mark Davis
text:
Austin, an exceptionally qualified attorney, has represented my best legal interests since 2013. Austin has always gone well above and beyond his required legal duty to protect my rights. I have personal knowledge of Austin doing the same for others.

Austin - accurately - will defend unwarranted legal filings made by opposing corrupt attorneys, he will file accurate legal filings without unnecessarily creating additional strife in your personal life all the while protecting your legal rights, he will personally drive across the state of Alabama for jailed clients working to obtain their freedom, he will call out injustice and attempt to correct it, and he knows - and gets - Constitutional law (a rarity in Alabama).

If Alabama had more attorneys like Austin working to protect citizen’s legal interests in doing what is right rather than lining pockets and making legal friendships our state would be a better place to live.

If you want to retain an effective attorney that will work timely and efficiently to protect your rights, Austin is the attorney to retain.

/s/ Mark Davis
Florence, Alabama
mark.davis.al@icloud.com

name: Mike McLarty
text:
After a lifetime of hard work in blue collar jobs I was suddenly laid off due to my heart going bad. I found myself unemployed and, sadly, unemployable at the age of 44 and with four children, one of which is severely disabled and will require lifetime care.

Ms. Thiry had helped a friend get her Disability Benefits and me, not knowing anything about how to find a lawyer for myself, contacted Ms. Thiry to discuss my case.

I was totally lost, despondent. I felt like my life was over. The shame of not being able to provide for my family was crippling. I began to look into how my family would be provided for if I passed. It was bad.

From the onset Renee was very compassionate and beyond helpful, as was her entire staff. Anytime I had a question it was answered quickly. She explained the process to me, was honest about the time it would take, and the difficulties of my case because of my age.

Looking back, I think it was her hope and encouragement that sustained me, because I had none of my own.

I was awarded Full Disability, and my back pay was set six entire months before I thought it would be. I don't know how that happened, but I am grateful to Ms. Thiry for making it so.

I have my life back now and, with whatever time I have left I can concentrate on making quality memories with my children. That would not be the case if not for Ms. Thiry's considerable attention to my claim and the dedication of her staff.

I consider her a family friend now and highly recommend her. Were it not for her keen legal mind, good heart, and professionalism I have no idea where I would be now, or if I even would be.

From the bottom of my (malfunctioning) heart, thank you Renee Thiry. You were my angel when me and my family needed one the most.

text: I don’t usually write reviews but I have to in this case. I needed an lawyer back in November 2010 after I was involved in a car accident on my job. I found THIRY & CADDELL, LLP on the internet on a Saturday night.  They actually reach out to me that Sunday morning. I had a face to face meeting with Mr. Richard Thiry the following Monday. Mr. Richard went above and beyond my expectations. He was very passionate about his clients and it shows in his work and spirit. The legal process was easy and stress free, I was very informed throughout the whole process by Mr. Richard and his team, and I felt at ease asking any questions I had. Richard Thiry was very diligent and got me a settlement quickly. Fast forwarding on June 14,2018 I was again involved in another car accident on the job after only been employed 2 days. I immediately reach out to THIRY & CADDELL, LLP. Mr. Richard no longer practice law because he had retired but his daughter Renee Thiry also is a lawyer there.  First, I'd like to say THANK YOU to Renee Thiry and the staff. They are very professional, personable and very helpful team.  Renee always keeps her word and came through for me when I needed her most. I hired Renee for my workers comp and personal injury suit.  Renee always made me feel that she had things under control and was on top of the case. My job terminate me after 7 months because of permeant injury due to the car accident. She help me get my unemployment to help me out until my case was settle. As a single mom with two kids it help out A LOT. My workers comp case has now been settled and i am so relieved and will be forever grateful. I know that she is also going to do a great job with my personal injury case as well. I honestly don't know what I would do without them. If you want the best then you definitely want to hire Renee Thiry.  I cannot thank her enough for all she is doing for me. I don't believe any lawyer could have done any better, that's why I truly believe they are the Best!!!!

text: I would give no stars if I could as I have made three calls over the course of two weeks seeking representation without a response. The answering service used is either not recording messages or the attorneys are being selective. I realize my matter is a small one; however, a return phone call within a reasonable amount of time is the bare minimum expectation this firm could not meet. I have worked in a prominent law firm for nearly a decade and know the value of customer service with every client, both large matters and small. I unfortunately cannot use that law firm as I moved a great distance away. Parkman and White, please return your phone calls, whether you can take the case or not. No firm is too big or an attorney too important to make a courtesy return call or email, at a minimum. You can even have your staff perform the task for you. This way a potential client cannot waste additional time and effort and can call someone else who cares enough to provide the service.

name: Jaclyn Skuce
text: She was very reassuring during a so-called free consultation, that I hired her immediately. Everything she said during the consultation ended up to be false. All she did for me was file a notice of appearance and never had time to meet or go over my case file. When we were only a couple days away from the next court date she claimed "My niece has been in a terrible accident and hanging on to life by threads.  I will be back in touch with you before end of week." That was the kinda responses I got for every email I sent. She never got back to me or had time for my case. After several phone calls to her office, where you cannot get a live person to answer. I finally got a phone call back which I did record. I asked for an itemized statement which she claimed she doesn't give those. I asked it I could speak with the legal assistant working on my case she claimed she doesn't have those. I asked how much I had left in my retainer so I would have proof, since I didn't trust her at all at this point. She wouldn't give me a number but claimed I had plenty left that she doesn't charge much for anything. After I fired her she sent an itemized statement claiming I only had a couple hundred left and it would be mailed to me. I have filed a BBB complaint and a dispute with credit card company. I have not received anything from her and this was months ago. Do not hire this lawyer. This has got to be fraud. $3500 for a notice of appearance.

name: Kaitlyn Head
text: I couldn’t be more pleased with Warren Freeman and his amazing assistant, Valerie. I had multiple felony drug charges that had been hanging over my head for nearly 4 years. Since those charges were brought against me, I had turned my life around and became the person that I was intended to be. Warren saw that. He listened to my story, he cared and he made sure he did everything in his power to get the outcome I truly deserved. In Warren’s words I was “a true success story” and he wasn’t going to let that go without being heard. He went over and beyond by meeting with the District Attorney multiple times to discuss my case. Even after negotiating a plea deal that I never dreamed possible, he still went back AGAIN and laid my story out – showing how I had turned my life around – and getting me an even better deal than before. Warren cared. He believed in me and my story. I will be forever grateful for the time and commitment he gave to my case.

name: Amy Parrish
text: My son hired Margret Casey to handle visitation of his daughter, he gave her permission to talk directly to me because of his work schedule and he referred to me for help. First, after we settled with Mom on visitation and ect.. we got the paper work and she had omitted an entire year of child visitation, she filed to have it corrected and filed it wrong, then we discovered she omitted another VERY important agreement that was made between them. I emailed her about it and she told me to email the Mom's attorney (unprofessional), I did so and copied her. A few days past and I never heard anything back so I emailed her again, she then told me it was not on the agreement made between them and sent the paper work I had sent her and the Mom's attorney. I told her I was confused, it was at the bottom right of the 2nd page, to which she replied oh I see now-ok, I will get an amendment filed. The next day, I asked her if she had reached out to Mom's attorney and she replied: Respectfully, there is no need to send ongoing emails, she said she would only communicate with my son going forward. She never even said she was sorry for messing up the papers 3 separate times. When we hired her, I explained that we knew we were not her only clients but this was very important to us. At first things seemed ok but once I paid the final bill and we discovered she left stuff out of the papers her attitude changed. When you make a mistake you apologize for the mistake and correct it, not make the client feel guilty for asking for it to be corrected.In addition to all of this, we were having my son added to the birth certificate, Margret told us to give it 2 months after the judge signed off on it and we could just get a copy at the Health Dept, when my son went to get it Vital Records had the birth certificate on hold because "our attorney" did not pay the $49.50 fee to have it changed nor were we EVER told about the fee. It took him 3 hours to get it straightened out. I would NOT recommend her to ANYONE. Respect goes both ways. When we met with her, I told her I knew we were not her only clients but this was VERY important to us. WE both felt disrespected, ignored, and treated unprofessional!

resp.text:
Ms. Parrish,

I am sorry you were not happy with my communication during my representation of your son.  While I do believe that we were able to attain the goals that your son set for the outcome of his court case, I appreciate you for pointing out that I exhibited a lack of respect for you. This was not intentional; in fact, I respect you very much.

Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your experience. I will use your comments to improve upon the way I listen to my clients and work to better understand what lies at the foundation of my client’s issues.

Margaret Casey

resp.text: When our firm gets involved in a legal matter, we strive to do the best job that we can for our client. text: Elizabeth is an exceptional attorney, and I felt led to leave her a review, not because she asked for one, but because she believed in me and fought for me the entire step of the way. She gave me advice when I needed it and told me the truth, and singlehandedly faced a team of lawyers and was able to get me, a man in the state of Alabama, almost equal time with my children and joint custody.  She was truly remarkable and I’m grateful a friend of mine recommended her to me. I truly believe she’s one of the best attorneys in Birmingham and would highly recommend her to anyone going through a divorce/custody situation. She’s a fighter, and that’s exactly what you need when you’re facing a situation like the one I was in. She’s also continuously encouraged me to be the mature and reasonable parent through the entire time, and I’m a better person and a better dad as a result of that. 5 stars and 2 thumbs up!

I'm very unsatisfied with this Law Firm. My attorney Gregory C Starkey was unprepared for court I was charged for preparing for court but he was very unprepared this was my first time meeting Mr. Starkey
As most of my interactions were via the receptionist. Most of my fees were phone calls with the receptionist which I didn't understand why I would be charged phone call fees of one to two minutes of $20 just to check with his receptionist to see if they got the information they were trying to get. I called to let the receptionist know my mother took a turn for the worst and I was charged $20 for a less than a 2 minute call where is the compassion in that? Finally when I called to let them know I was very dissatisfied with how this Law Firm treated my case they charge me for that phone call also which was made with the receptionist. I called after court later that afternoon and ask the receptionist which he have Mr. Starkey give me a call I was charged $40 for this call of being displeased  and asking for him to give me a call and she said we're not able to get in contact with him. I never heard back from him. When hiring an attorney the one thing thats important is for your attorney to have some type of compassion, for your attorney to not just take a persons money, and for that attorney to try to come up with some solution if you're not pleased with their service.

name: Alan Richards
text:
Did a great job for me after a DUI....
I have never had the need for a criminal defense lawyer – until I did!  I hired Mr. Russell Crumbley based on two recommendations from persons who work in the legal business.  Now, I am the one recommending Russ and his team at Crumbley-Blackwell & Associates to anyone reading this.  Just hours after my arrest, I was able to make an appointment before my first visit to the court.  Having never been in this situation before, this was very important to me.  Russ was with me every step of the way.  In the end, my case was dismissed thanks to this fine law firm.
There were many court appearances, so I was able to observe his interactions with other defense lawyers, prosecutors, and two judges.  It was obvious to me that he is well liked and, more importantly, well respected in the legal community.  It takes more than just navigating the legal system (which Russ did with ease), it also takes relationships.
Again, I highly recommend Mr. Crumbley and will never forget what he did for me.

resp.text: Thank you, so much, Alan for those kind words. It was a privilege to represent you and I am really glad it worked out for you. It was quite stressful for you but it is behind you now. Best wishes for you moving forward. ~ Russell

name: Christopher Fitzgibbon
text:
Chris F.

I was arrested nearly 2 years after a bar fight for felony assault, had never been arrested before and both a family friend and the bail bondsman recommended Crumbley-Blackwell. I hired Mr. Crumbley as my lawyer and he did everything he could. They tried to get me to take a plea for a misdemeanor and 2 years probation and Mr. Crumbley easily could of just told me to take it, as he was already paid and could of dumped me off and move on, but he insisted we take it to trial because he thought wasn't right what was happening and i never should of been arrested or charged for defending myself when I was attacked. He believed we could win and so I went with his advice. In the end right before the trial he got all charges dismissed and even court fees waived and I just had to pay a small restitution fee. Hiring Mr. Crumbley was the best decision I could have made and am extremely thankful to him and his firm for everything. Hopefully I never have any use for him again but if I'm ever in a bad way again he'll definitely be my first call.

resp.text: Chris: I felt strongly about your case. I hated you had to go through what you did. It took guts on your part so kudos to you, sir. You stood strong. I just stood beside you. Be blessed! ~ Russell

name: Mary Windham
text: About the same as Hodge. My brother recommended Crumblee. I have made three attempts. Each one has been the bums rush. Strike three, you're out.

resp.text: Bums rush? Three attempts? You really don't provide me with much to go on here but if you have a legal matter with which we can help ... that is what we do! If you need to speak with me please TEXT ME at 256-503-1185 and I will personally call you from my cell phone and help you decide if you have a case with which we can help you.
