name: JW Wryta
text: I am a male 37 year old honor discharged protected veteran who holds a Masters Degree and has never had any issues with the law prior to my DUI in 2017.  While my charges were from 2017, I was not arrested until 2019 because I was sent to the hospital on the date of the offense instead of jail and diagnosed with Sudden Traumatic Shock exasperated by alcohol.  Being arrested was completely out of the norm for me.  I did not know where to begin, what to expect, and was consistently imagining the worst possible outcomes and scenarios.  Based off my charges, my bail agent highly recommended that I contact Mr. Crumbly for counsel.  I had an initial meeting with Mr. Crumbly within a week from the first time I contacted him.  The initial meeting did not take longer then an hour and during that time Mr. Crumbly was able to explain all my available options to include representation options, payment options, court expectations, and expected timelines.  Perhaps the most beneficial thing Mr. Crumbly discussed in the initial meeting was the overall stress of the situation.  He told me that it was human nature to imagine the worst possible outcomes and to not worry about that as it was him and his teams job to make sure those outcomes don’t happen.  He was absolutely right and ,during the entire course of my case, I constantly imagined the worst possible scenarios; however, I always made myself think back to that initial conversation with Mr. Crumbly and remembered that is why he is there.  After that initial meeting, Mr. Crumbly and his team handled everything for 6 months up until my court date with the Judge.  Before I even had to go before the Judge, Mr. Crumbly had secured a deal with the DA for me to enter the Pre-Trial Intervention Program (PTIP) and have charges dropped following the completion of the program.  I was more than happy to enter PTIP as it took all uncertainty and stress off the table and I was able to hold everything going forward in my own hands.  As of May 2020, I have successfully completed the PTIP program and am currently working with Mr. Crumbly on having my charges expunged.  I am very pleased with the services I have received from Mr. Crumbly and his team and would highly recommend them.  While I am not going to put personal information on here for obvious reasons, Mr. Crumbly has my full permission to give my number to prospective clients who would like a recommendation.

resp.text: JW: It was a pleasure to work with/for you. And, YOU sir, did a great job yourself. ~ Russell

name: Greg Kaltz
text:
TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN-

In March of 2014 I was charged with a DUI in Madison County, Alabama. This led to several serious concerns I had as to what negative impacts this DUI might have regarding maintaining my current place of employment, a valid Alabama Driver’s License, and the potential for increased auto insurance rates. In addition, I was uninformed of all the specific issues pertaining to Alabama State Law as they apply to a DUI charge especially, with respect to possible fines, imprisonment, unknown future adverse impacts, or establishment of an unfavorable permanent criminal history. The level of stress in my daily life was extremely high, to say the least, due to this situation and these concerns.

I was referred to the Law Office(s) of Russell W. Crumbley to try and sort all these issues out. Russell put me immediately at ease and clarified for me, in a no-nonsense way, what needed to be done to effectively address the DUI charge against me. He also kept me informed as to the current status of my case as it made its way through the Alabama judicial process and provided reassuring personal representation at any and all court scheduled hearings or appointments. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND retaining Russell as your DUI Attorney should you ever find yourself in a similar situation. He is a completely knowledgeable and competent attorney in the area of Alabama DUI Criminal Law and you can rest assured that he will obtain the best possible outcome regarding your case.

Sincerely Yours-

Greg Kaltz

P.S. – Due to Russell’s expertise, he obtained a DISMISSAL of the DUI charges against me! He is also handling a follow-on expungement action for me that will clear my Alabama arrest record for DUI.

resp.text: Greg: It was a pleasure. Thank you! ~ Russell

name: Brock Grayson
text: Mr. Russell Crumbley took good care of my DUI case and was an expert in all things considered. He took the stress out of my hands and life and handled everything in a professional manner. On a Sunday, he was the only office that took my phone call, I had to be at court the next day after my arrest at 8 AM. Every office was closed, including Crumbley's. However, on his website there was a chat option in which he took my request and talked to me personally. On that very Sunday he met with me within an hour. He was on his way back from Tuscaloosa and still met with me! I've never been so stressed, but after meeting with Mr. Crumbley, he assured me I would be taken care of. The results: My case was nolle prossed: thrown out. All I had to do was sit back, and relax while Russ took care of the rest. If you want positive results, do yourself and stress level a favor and call his office and have him represent you. You will not regret it.

There are options in this town. We tend to appreciate those people who choose us. Again, THANK YOU! ~ Russell

name: Refinnej
text:
Mr. Crumbley has been extremely helpful a couple times for me.  His office has been helpful and detail oriented to ensure that we knew everything that was going on and kept me up to date every step of the way.  They were always friendly and accommodating.  Even while not representing me, he was able to give me some great advice about my father's will and estate after my father had passed away.  He took the time out of his busy day to tell me what I needed to do and who it would be that I needed to find and contact once it went to probate.  This is not his area of expertise, he was just helping me know where to start.  He explained to me the process.   Since it was a large city that my father lived in, it was a while before the estate went to probate and I assumed I had been written out due to my father's controlling sister so I didn't bother looking into it until 2 years later when I was found by a life insurance company and received a letter explaining that I was the beneficiary of a policy.  I then took Mr. Crumbley's advice by finding the attorney through the probate court and found that I had many savings bonds, which the sister told me had been spent 10 years prior.  The executrix allegedly told the attorney that she tried to contact me, but she did not  Thanks to these cushions I have been able to go back to school.

I want to add, if anyone is in legal trouble, please seek counsel.  The DA will lie straight to your face.  The DA will threaten you with the highest jail terms to get you to plead guilty so they don't have to take it to trial.  Their in house legal assistants that are there to help guide defendants will tell you that if you don't take the plea "deal" that you wont win.  They are only there to help the DA, not you.  It's very difficult, especially when it's your word against law enforcement officers, many who have no problem lying in court and they're buddies with the judge.  You need someone who knows the law and knows how the courts work.  It wont be free, but it's worth it to not have to go to jail and/or have a record haunting you.  For more serious crimes, you may get a public defender, but your life is on the line with someone who may not care about you or what happens to you.  It's a dangerous risk to take and once you are convicted, it's harder to find people to listen to you.

resp.text: How kind of you. Thank you. What a mountain of burden you had going on in your life. Thanks for letting us help you navigate through it. ~ Russell

name: Refinnej
text:
Mr. Crumbley has been extremely helpful a couple times for me.  His office has been helpful and detail oriented to ensure that we knew everything that was going on and kept me up to date every step of the way.  They were always friendly and accommodating.  Even while not representing me, he was able to give me some great advice about my father's will and estate after my father had passed away.  He took the time out of his busy day to tell me what I needed to do and who it would be that I needed to find and contact once it went to probate.  This is not his area of expertise, he was just helping me know where to start.  He explained to me the process.   Since it was a large city that my father lived in, it was a while before the estate went to probate and I assumed I had been written out due to my father's controlling sister so I didn't bother looking into it until 2 years later when I was found by a life insurance company and received a letter explaining that I was the beneficiary of a policy.  I then took Mr. Crumbley's advice by finding the attorney through the probate court and found that I had many savings bonds, which the sister told me had been spent 10 years prior.  The executrix allegedly told the attorney that she tried to contact me, but she did not  Thanks to these cushions I have been able to go back to school.

I want to add, if anyone is in legal trouble, please seek counsel.  The DA will lie straight to your face.  The DA will threaten you with the highest jail terms to get you to plead guilty so they don't have to take it to trial.  Their in house legal assistants that are there to help guide defendants will tell you that if you don't take the plea "deal" that you wont win.  They are only there to help the DA, not you.  It's very difficult, especially when it's your word against law enforcement officers, many who have no problem lying in court and they're buddies with the judge.  You need someone who knows the law and knows how the courts work.  It wont be free, but it's worth it to not have to go to jail and/or have a record haunting you.  For more serious crimes, you may get a public defender, but your life is on the line with someone who may not care about you or what happens to you.  It's a dangerous risk to take and once you are convicted, it's harder to find people to listen to you.

resp.text: How kind of you. Thank you. What a mountain of burden you had going on in your life. Thanks for letting us help you navigate through it. ~ Russell

text: My husband went for a consultation about some legal issues and the lawyer he spoke with would not listen and just dismissed him without knowing all the information. I would NEVER recommend this firm to anybody.

In either event, I would invite you and/or your husband to reach out to me via email (russ@crumbleylaw.com). Leave me a number and I will personally call you and/ or your husband at my very earliest opportunity. You certainly may come to the office but I am offering to make this as easy as possible for you. I am here for either, or both, of you. I will make sure your husband is heard. I will make sure he knows he is heard. I don't know if he has an issue we can help him with but, if we can't, I will make sure he understands that and I will make sure he understands why. If we can't help but I know someone who can I will give him a name and number of that lawyer. I am here to help - not frustrate. Thank you for your time. ~ Russell Crumbley

name: Cheryl Mellema
text:
Mr. Crumbley’s office called me the day after I posted my review of his partner, and asked if I would speak with Mr. Crumbley at his office. When I explained I was busy I was asked if I would speak with him over the phone. I agreed and I was transfered to Mr. Crumbley.  After listening to me explain my why I left the review and my account of my interactions with Mr. Matt Wisda, Mr. Crumbley asked me several questions.
1. Would I consider removing my review?
2. Would I consider moving it to Mr. Wisda’s webpage?
3. If he (Crumbley) were to fire Mr. Wisda would I then delete my review! I said no.
4. Was there ANYTHING he (Crumbley) could say or do that would result in me removing the review? To which I responded “Not ethically”, because I felt he was trying to “lead me” into asking for a monetary resolution.

During our discussion Mr. Crumbley stated he was not at all happy about Mr. Wisda’s conduct. And that he was considering actions (including termination).  He asked once more if there was anything he could do To get me to retract the review against “Crumbley, Blackwell, & Wisda Lawfirm”.  I explained to him that when I researched Divorce Attorneys/Firms I based my decision in part on the reviews of his Firms website and information regarding the lawyers and therefore would not consider removing the review. We said goodbye and I hung up.

I spent that day wondering if he would call again. I just knew “IT” wasn’t over.
So this evening I checked on my review out of curiosity...and wouldn’t you know it there is this long drawn out explanation that it was I who was misinformed etc.  Never once mentioning any unethical behavior on behalf of Mr. Wisda!
I want to SHOUT from the highest rooftops what a sleazy slimeball you are! Shall I post more? Shall I post information Mr. Wisda freely disclosed to me about a clearly VERY SENSITIVE divorce and custody battle where the children involved had been...!
You disgust me!

I retained Matt Wisda to represent me for my divorce.  I feel he acted unethically.
I contacted his office after receiving an invoice for services that were not rendered. When I followed up with an appointment a few days later not only did he begin by talking about another case he had been working on (this was the 2nd time he mentioned details of this other party's case!) but he also presented me with an official Settlement Agreement" that clearly stated me and my spouse had both agreed to - WHICH NEITHER OF US HAD!

We never went through discovery at all! No mediation - nothing!
The entire document looked copy and pasted, and all of the assets and then some were to be awarded to me!

Mr. Wisda was trying to fool me into thinking he had been hard at work on my case and that I was entitled to everything when in fact he hadn't done anything. Additionally It was never my intention to try take my husband to the proverbial cleaners. I just wanted a fair settlement.

I didn't even look at the "Settlement Agreement" he'd drawn up while at his office. I had already decided to sever our business agreement and told him so.  I asked when I could pick up my remaining retainer and he said it would be about a week.

When I went to pick up the monies, enclosed with my check was an invoice of almost $700 for the bogus "Settlement Agreement" that had been drawn up without consultation or discovery.  Coincidentally the new invoice showed just one line item for the preparing of said agreement which was dated after the phone call I mentioned above.

I immediately drew up a letter refusing to pay and insisting I be refunded.  Additionally in the letter I called him out for trying to fool me and get paid for it. I emailed this letter and received a response early the next morning stating they would immediately refund the that money, which they did.

I am leaving this review to make others aware.  In our consultation meeting he told me his practice "is like a game to me."  And because  conducting his business in such a way, I feel, is an abuse of his power as an attorney and is extremely unethical.

resp.text:
We deeply regret that your experience with our office did not meet your expectation. We work very hard to not let that happen. Having said that, you say that you received a “settlement agreement” that indicated you and your husband had agreed to the settlement terms when, in fact, you had not agreed. You also say that this agreement was put together without doing any “discovery” or any “mediation”. You initially hired Mr. Wisda to assist you in negotiating an uncontested divorce with your husband’s lawyer. In fact, you produced, for us, a “settlement agreement” created by your husband’s lawyer when you hired Mr. Wisda. That settlement agreement had already been prepared absent any “discovery” or attempt to “mediate”. It was clearly the intentions of both parties (and their lawyers) to settle this matter, if possible, without costly litigation. This type divorce typically does not involve “discovery” (in the traditional sense) and most certainly doesn’t involve “mediation”. In these type matters we simply go with settlement negotiations to the extent we are able, which necessarily includes “settlement proposals”. Also, in this type situation, both parties tend to agree that they know what the assets are and their values are not in dispute.

The “settlement agreement” your husband’s attorney prepared, and gave you, was just like the one Mr. Wisda gave you. In reviewing your husband’s proposal it is noted that it also includes language stating that the two of you “acknowledged and agreed” to things that you had not already agreed upon. In other words, both lawyers settlement agreements included the very same language in that regard. In fact, most paragraphs in all settlement agreements are full of language such as “the parties acknowledge and agree …”. This language is included to satisfy legal requirements and applies to you ONLY AFTER you have actually read it, agreed to it and signed it. It is not intended to mean that you have already seen it and agreed to it. And, it is NEVER INTENDED to deceive. Your attorney, Matt Wisda, did exactly what your husband’s lawyer did with respect to that language.

As far as the “attempt to fool you” is concerned: you received an itemized statement of the charges. You received two billing statements. The second of those two seems to be where you objected. That statement involves the “settlement agreement”. You were dissatisfied with that charge and objected to that bill and, although you had NOT notified him of your desire to terminate him until after that work was done, we refunded every penny to you of that part of the bill. And your objection, as much as any we can tell, is founded on your belief that it included the “bogus” settlement language indicating that you and your husband had agreed to the terms that you had not agreed to.

We strive to handle cases the way our clients direct us. And, while the services you received were not satisfactory to you, Mr. Wisda DID NOT bill you for services not rendered. His conduct was not unethical. His ability to communicate effectively with you, I will agree, must have missed the mark. For example, we are not sure how, exactly, you did not understand that the “acknowledged and agreed” language in the settlement agreement did not mean you had both already agreed to that agreement. That was no more the intent of what Mr. Wisda provided you than it was the intent of what your husband’s attorney provided him. It was merely two lawyers doing their jobs and adding the language that was going to be necessary at some point, in advance. Perhaps THAT is why it looked copied and pasted.

We would encourage ANYONE who is dissatisfied in ANY way, with ANYONE in our office, to meet with any of us. WE ARE ALWAYS AVAILABLE to meet with that person and do everything we can to alleviate their concern and fight for your cause. Your case matters to us. And, YOU matter to us. Best wishes moving forward during this trying time.

~ Russell Crumbley & Matt Wisda

text: I came to Mr. Crumbley with a domestic violence case in Huntsville VS me. I am an aerospace engineer here in Huntsville, and, like many of you, hold a security clearance. I had never been in any trouble before so I wasn't sure how to go about things when the public defender asked me how I wanted to plea.. she told me to plea guilty and pay the county for a class that may or may not get the charges dropped. After getting some much needed advice from a kind correctional officer outside, I declined that plea and decided to plea not-guilty and seek out my own legal counsel. I found Mr. Crumbley's office and the charges ended up being dropped/dismissed. Him and his team, even the front office, they were all excellent. Couldn't have asked for a better outcome. Now my life, my clearance and my job will remain in tact. Everyone has the blurb at the end of their advertisements saying "no representation is made that the quality of legal services performed is greater than that of other lawyers" but I'm not sure I agree with that. Mr. Crumbley really knows what he's doing and takes the time to understand where your coming from, what you are trying to do, and came up with a fantastic plan to get me there. Thanks again, to the whole office and team at Crumbley, Blackwell, Wisda and Asc.

resp.text: Wow! I have fought for clients for 21 years but, as far as I know, this is the first time a client has fought for me. I never really thought about clients reading other people's reviews before they write their own but I guess they do. I think you were more upset than I was. But, I have learned over the years that people see things, view things, expect things and interpret things differently from each other. As they say: "one man's trash is another man's treasure". EVERYTHING must be ALWAYS viewed with the proper perspective. I appreciate your strong, heartfelt words but they weren't necessary. We take cases all across the board and that includes cases that are very difficult and filled with a multitude of considerations, possibilities and opportunities - even for failure. Sometimes the absolute best outcome still falls short of the perfect outcome. I think most people understand that. Having said that, God Bless you young man. Many thanks! ~ Russell

name: mike money
text: I retained Mr. Crumbley to represent me on a DUI in the city of Madison. I had heard a lot of good things about him and his firm from other people that had used his services. I scheduled a consultation and went to meet Mr. Crumbley. I was very nervous about my situation, but within minutes he had me at ease and feeling confident we would win this case. During our meeting, Mr. Crumbley was very professional and knowledgeable and easy to talk to. I followed his advice and we took the case to a jury trial in the higher court. We were scheduled court dates several times and each time I went, the court wasn’t able to try the case at that time and would reschedule at a later date. Jump forward 6 years (that’s our court system), and the court finally scheduled a court date. So since it had been 6 years, I had moved a couple of times so the court didn’t have my current address so I was never notified of the new date. Mr. Crumbley still appeared in court on my behalf, he informed the court that he had tried to contact me but was unable to reach me. The court was talking about doing several different things, but Mr. Crumbley kept fighting on my behalf to reach a solution that was in my best interest. The day after my court date, I had a missed call, I called the number and it was Mr. Crumbley’s office. His staff found out who had tried to contact me, next thing I know, Mr. Crumbley was on the phone. He told me about the missed court date, and I’m thinking Ok, bench warrant!!! He continued to tell me the news….Case is Dismissed!!! What better outcome could there be. Thanks Russell.

resp.text: Mike: THANK YOU for that. But, I just did what you hired me to do ... I kept fighting. And, it certainly worked out better than I expected. Just goes to show ... you never know until you go try. God Bless!

I will thank you in advance for helping us/me maintain a helpful and caring environment for our clients who are, for the record, the most important people to walk through our doors.

resp.text: Jacob: It is very disappointing to see your level of disappointment. After a review of our records, it appears as though this review stems from issues about 10 years ago. Jon and I bend over backwards for our clients to try to get the best results possible. We have tried many cases in front of a jury. We get MOST cases dismissed and, of course,  some clients do enter a guilty plea. However, every case is different and has it's own variables, nuances and circumstances (both in fact and in law). For that reason, alone, we never make promises or guarantees - even when we believe we could. That is just not good business. The ONLY thing I know to do is to reach out to you and I have done that - to no avail. My office and my phone line remain open to you. In either event, we wish you nothing but the best. ~ Russell

text: During the onset of my divorce, I felt lost and overwhelmed. I googled lawyers and FAQs, anything to help me figure out what my first step needed to be. I figured it was some ploy or scam to get my name and number that would lead to a flood of annoying calls, but I decided I had nothing to loose, so I chatted about my situation. It turns out, I was chatting with my future lawyer! That same week I met Niki and as soon as she shook my hand...I knew she was the answer to my prayers. Hands down, an amazing woman and a powerful lawyer. After my divorce, I brought the company I work for to Adam Jones and Associates. I can honestly say, on a personal level with my divorce and on a professional level with the cases I deal with at work, Adam Jones and Associates is my lifetime firm. One chat session lead to one phone call, one hand shake lead to one case, and now they are my lawyer, my family's lawyers, and my company's lawyers. They really do cater to their clients needs. I can not express my support for this firm enough! I remember emailing my lawyer at 3am and she was not only there for me legally, but as a friend as well. That is what makes me a forever customer, knowing my problem is not a paycheck to these guys, it is their problem too and they mean it.

name: deborah Ray
text: When my husband at the time told me we needed to go our separate ways I had no idea where to go to find an attorney.  So I pulled out a Yellow pages phone book and started looking at the ads for divorce attorneys.  There was one that caught my eye and I liked their ad.  They also had a video you could watch & it really impressed me because they were so family oriented.  I made an appointment for a free consultation.  I was very impressed by the attention I got & the answers I received so I retained them.  They told me I could call any time I had a question or didn’t understand something.  Well believe me I called with questions all the time (early in the morning or in the evenings) and even sent emails, lots of emails and they had answers for me & quickly.  If they didn’t have an answer they researched it and got back to me.  They fought for my case and fought hard.  They were very thorough and knew what questions to ask the opposing attorney.  I received everything I asked for and more.  I couldn’t be happier.  The whole staff at The Rose Law Firm, LLC was there for me.  If I had to do it all over again to hire an attorney, it would definitely be The Rose Law Firm, LLC—100%.  If anyone has any questions please feel free to look me up on FB and message me.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kindness Ms. Ray! I'm so glad that we were able to help and get your goals accomplished. Our door is always open and my phone on should you need anything in the future. God Bless, Jennifer

name: Google User
text:
Hard to find fault with great legal service
The Rose Law Firm successfully wrapped up a contentious divorce for me recently and this is how I'd rate them. Service 10/10 Attorneys Ronilo and Haynes gave me their cell numbers, were always available at ALL hours through phones email or text, answered all my questions quickly and in detail, treated me with respect and always made me feel like my case and family was very important to them. What more can you ask? Price 8/10 I've used other attorneys in the past and shopped around too. The rates here fall about the middle of the range of all attorneys in town. Considering their expertise I feel like they were a bargain as I've found (and used) attorneys who were obviously not as talented or knowledgeable charging double the retainers. Results 10/10 I asked for a lot and they delivered, not much else to say. They came to every hearing, deposition, and finally my trial very prepared and polished. Thankfully they were very aggressive in arguing for me and in moving the case forward or I think the other side would have dragged their feet forever. I'm very happy with how everything turned out. Overall 10/10 I hope to never get divorced again but I would use these ladies if I did. Overall I'm very satisfied. Thank you to everyone who worked on my case.

name: Regina Hall
text: Could not afford these people, I know they are good at what they do but, they wanted 8.000, a child for a custody case. I have 4

resp.text:
Ms. Hall, Thank you for the compliment, I apologize that you were not able to retain our services. That said, I'm afraid there might have been some confusion on the pricing. When I looked at the notes from your free consultation from a little over a year ago, I see there was a quote for two separate cases for $8,000 total.  We don't charge by the child, only by the case and it's complexity, and I apologize that there was somehow confusion in that regard. We always strive to keep our costs competitive and our hourly costs are generally the same or lower (up to 40 percent or more in some cases) than firms with similar experience as us. There will always be someone who will do the job cheaper but that comes at a cost as well. Our attorneys go to specialized family law specific training and only practice family law every day and it does make a difference, especially vs. someone who does little family law, is newer, or does whatever kind of legal work comes along. I wish you well and hope you have been able to get resolution; if you ever want to talk to us about anything our doors are still open.
God bless,
Jennifer Rose

name: Angel Bearden
text: This law firm is a true rip off!! If you care about your child please find another law firm to represent you! They only care about the money I paid them over 20,000 and we never went to court that was 20,000 of paperwork and emails.  I went to another attorney paid 2500.00 and got results.  Please save your money they don’t care about the client or the children.

resp.text: I’m so very sorry you were disappointed. Our goal is always to minimize your stress as much as possible by completing cases as quickly, efficiently, and painless as possible under any given circumstance, and though we did try to do just that, I can understand your frustration at the entire situation you were put in to begin with by the opposing party. Unfortunately, as you witnessed, we do occasionally run into an extremely uncooperative opposing party who wants nothing more than to make the process more painful for everyone and who is intent on dragging the process out by any means necessary even if that means making serious allegations that we have to defend the client from. Although I really hated to lose you as a client right at the very end of your case, I’m happy that we were able to take care of almost all necessary litigation for you including depositions, temporary hearings, the entire discovery process, and a settlement conference. I’m glad to hear that someone else was able to pick right up where we left off and take care of the last steps for you in order to finish up your case. We have also been in the position many times wherein we’ve taken over for another attorney and have been able to finish things relatively quickly due to most of the work already having been done, as it was in your particular situation.  Again, I’m very sorry that the process was made so unnecessarily painful for you by the opposing party. That said, if you ever need support, if we can help you in any other way, or you just want to talk about all of this in more detail, please feel free to call us on our cell phones as we’re always more than happy to answer your call. God bless,  Jennifer

resp.text:
Thank you so much! I'm very happy that Katherine got you what you were looking for and that your children are safe and sound. She's an awesome attorney and we are lucky to have her. Don't hesitate to call if you ever need anything at all.
God Bless, Jennifer

name: Jammie Walker
text:
Rose Law Firm only took $$$$, and never made it to court after hiring them for a year. Simple case that should jave been settled in a few months at the longest. They charge for everything, phone calls, reading emails etc. Thousands of dollars one year later we fired them. Oh and did i mention you have to pay in advance or they do Nothing. They did nothing anyway.  I Highly Do Not Recommend this Law Firm.
Run Away Far and Fast!!

resp.text:
Ms. Walker, I'm sorry you're upset. Although you were paying the legal fees for someone else, you were not the client yourself and as such there's a limit to what we were allowed to divulge without express permission from the client. I can say that unless otherwise directed by a client we always seek settlement as a first option to minimize costs and give our client an assured outcome. That said, although we are very proficient at drafting and negotiating settlement proposals, we can't actually force the two sides to agree to them against their will. We do take retainer fees and we do charge for our time which includes things like phone calls and emails; however, these are standard legal fees and discussed upfront with our clients in person and covered in our brief retainer agreement. We are very transparent in the work we do and everything that we bill for.  We work hard to finish our client's cases quickly but some things that are out of our control such as the court's schedule and opposing side's cooperation as well as the details of the case itself can hinder the speed we can complete the job.
God bless,
Jennifer G. Rose

name: Christy
text: Had 3 different attorneys over the time my case was handled by this firm, yet Ms. Rose never spoke to me personally, or set foot in court for me.   The day of my hearing, the attorney forgot all documentation and asked me if i could bring copies from home for him.   If you have a lot of money to waste they will gladly take it.

resp.text: Ms. Jennings, I’m so sorry that you were disappointed; I can understand your frustration. Although we’re all human, I personally would not easily excuse or have faith in any attorney that forgot a file even if it didn’t have any outcome on your final case disposition. I have very high standards for myself and anyone that works for me and I can assure you I would have dealt with this former associate had you made me aware at the time. Regardless, I sincerely apologize. Although forgetting a file was totally out of character for him, I hope you can take some solace in the fact that he is no longer with the firm and has not been for over 5 years.  Although many years have passed since your case, you might recall that I was dealing with a life-threatening medical issue when you hired the firm and was not able to take your case on myself and thus the reason you used my associate at that time.  As far as multiple attorneys are concerned, I assume you are referring to our collaborative approach to law. We often have a primary and second chair attorney on a case working together. While this doesn’t affect the overall cost of your case, the benefits to you can be immense. For instance, though all our attorneys are great we will use each attorney’s greatest strengths to your advantage, so if someone is a better writer or researcher they might be assigned to that portion of your case. In addition, when it comes time to strategize on your case, instead of one attorney coming up with a strategy, you might have three or four working out the best strategy though you will only get billed for the time of one. In effect, you get the knowledge and expertise of multiple full-time family law attorneys for the price of one. This is something most firms can’t offer. I apologize if this process wasn’t clearly explained at the outset of your retaining of the firm. I will make sure that going forward we outline the process in writing to make it easier for clients to understand. Thank you again for your input, if you’d ever like to talk about this in further detail my office door is always open and my phone on.

name: Lois Hernandez
text: I was very fortunate to have Jennifer Rose as my attorney during my child custody case.  She helped make the process as painless as possible and stayed on top of the case as it proceeded. name: Tia Spruill
text:
***WARNING**** $12,000.00 laters and barely 2 months of representing me for custody of my son****
HIRED May 10, 2018 FIRED JUNE 21,2018
If I could give this law firm a ZERO I would.
This Law Firm filed the following - 1-A notice of appearance - 2-a continuation - 3-created interrogatories and Showed up to court for 4 hours and did NOTHING!
MY son’s father is a felon, committing adultery, tax evasion and the list goes on. Sandra Remington at the Rose Lawfirm, Birmingham, AL. ONLY was able to secure me one supervised phone call a day and one supervised visitation a WEEK! They acted like I was the criminal. I traveled from Alaska and am sitting here now waiting for six days to pass to see my son, my baby my heart.  She told me NOT to hire a Guardian Ad Litem for my son.
THE ROSE LAWFIRM WILL DO NOTHING BUT TAKE YOUR MONEY.  This is the type of attorneys we are ALL warned about. If you want a GOOD attorney I would go else where. I fired her that SAME DAY WE LEFT COURT and hired a new attorney.

name: a google user
text:
I have so many things I can say about this firm with evidence to back it. I will start with not being notified of canceled meetings and court dates. Actually I got a call one time canceling a meeting that I wasn't even told I had. Was informed by the defendant about a court cancelation and then a few days later received the letter from my attorney with a post marked date after my court date. The firm had to postpone my last court date because my attorney had another client that had a case to carry over from the previous week. When I questioned Mrs. Rose about hiring a new attorney and putting her on my case she told me I hired the Rose Law Firm not her.  With invoices showing her reviewing my case and me being charged for it I asked her why there was nobody from the firm there to represent me instead of me having to postpone again and her answer to me was “your case may not have been tried anyways ". You are charged for each email to and from as .10 of an hour unless there is an attachment and then it is .20. If you have a meeting scheduled and they have to cancel then you are charged for them to call and tell you. You are charged for them to park for court. Over a year and a half and all that has been done is cases postponed, deposition, emails, phone calls, 4 or 5 subpoenas, and a temporary order  that had to let my son live with his mother until another court date could be scheduled and I promise people would not believe what  I have paid for this service. Was told I would get a special setting for my case in order to get this done and now have found out the court  date scheduled for 4 months later is not a special setting and will most likely be pushed back further and cost me several thousand more dollars. I could go over the 4000 characters very easily with the way my case has been handled by this firm but if I can save one person from this problem then the $20,000+ will not have been ifor nothing.

PS.....the firm has withdrawn from my case without letting me know and now I am just out those many thousands of dollars and have to start over with a new attorney which proves this firm cares about one thing and it is not your family. MY NEW ATTORNEY HAD THE CASE COMPLETELY FINISHED IN 3 MONTHS!!!!

resp.text: Dear Anonymous, I apologize that you were disappointed in our services. I would love if you could call me or visit the office so that we can speak about your experience and how we may improve going forward.  It sounds as if there was some miscommunication, particularly with the notice we normally send out after the court reschedules a hearing. The letter is just sent to remind you of the rescheduling we talked about in our phone calls and emails prior to the court date, however,  it adds the new date the court has given us so you can put it on your calendar. Hopefully you will give me opportunity to address and clear up any other concerns as client feedback is very important to us.

Though I know we are not as cheap as someone fresh out of law school or someone who does family law on the side, we are far from the most expensive family law attorneys in town. If you compare our prices to attorneys with similar credentials I think you will see that our prices are very competitive and quite a bit lower in many cases. Our prices are based on demand like all attorneys, but we've tried to keep our rates where we can provide a lot of value as well. Regardless, I hope our recommendations for someone who could assist you on a very limited budget were useful. Please don't hesitate to call us if you need any other help or advice.
God Bless, Jennifer

text: Almost killed myself coming down their stairs

resp.text:
Ms. Heard, I hate to hear you had some difficulty with the stairs, my apologies. We are disability friendly and as such we have options for visitors with mobility issues. Our staff is trained to always offer the elevator as an alternative for anyone who needs or would prefer it to walking the stairs to the second floor when meeting attorneys; if this was not the case, please call me. As for the 6 steps at our building entrance, we also have an ADA compliant ramp entrance at the rear. Hope you are doing well.
God bless,
Jennifer G. Rose

name: Ken L
text: I gave Rose Law Firm of a retainer for $2,000 for my child support case.  Several months later they refused to give me an update and had the gall to ask for more money.  I spent $2000 on nothing.

resp.text:
I'm truly sorry that your experience was disappointing. We do pride ourselves on keeping our clients up to date by providing instant updates on every client's case through email and also by giving you your attorney's personal cell number to call or text 24/7 with any questions or worries.  As we explain at the outset of hiring, our rates for a contested case, like most reputable attorneys, are billed on an hourly basis as the time spent varies per case. I'm not sure if there has been a misunderstanding but I'd love if you could call or text me so I can make sure everything is perfect going forward.
God Bless, Jennifer

name: MLC
text: Very long wait to see an attorney even with an appointment..

resp.text:
I apologize for your wait, this is definitely not the type of service we normally provide or that anyone should expect. Though we stay busy, we go out of our way to space out our free consultations for our client's privacy and comfort, and thus we purposely don't pack the waiting room full. I can appreciate how that made your wait that much more frustrating. In this situation it was the last day before Christmas break and one of the two attorneys that were due to be in office that day had to leave as her child became ill. The remaining attorney decided that instead of cancelling client consults and making them wait another week until the holiday break ended that she could meet with every consult herself. She was on schedule until a current client called her at the end of the day with an unexpected emergency issue that she had to be handle before the courts closed for Christmas. She took care of this client's issue as quickly as possible but this still put her about 30 minutes behind for your consult. Although she did stay over an extra hour after closing time to meet with you, I'm sorry you had to wait in the first place. If you should ever need us in the future please don't hesitate to call us, I can assure you that you will not be met with a wait again.
God Bless, Jennifer

name: Joyce Edwards
text: Mr. Smith and his paralegal Ms. Mason went above and beyond to obtain the best possible settlement in my divorce. Because this was the end of a 33 year marriage they were very thorough in obtaining all the information needed in order to have a fair division of financial and property assets, along with the facts needed in obtaining a fair alimony settlement. I had moved to another state for my own peace of mind, but I was always kept informed. I did have to return for a temporary support hearing and mediation, which was to be expected. From the time my ex-spouse was served with papers to the finalization of the the divorce was about 7 months.  I feel very blessed that Mr. Smith and Ms. Mason were able to bring closure as quickly as they did in my contested divorce process. Mr. Smith knows the family law concerning divorce matters and can go about this process in a calm and respectful manner to everyone that's involved yet get his point across in the best interest of his client. If you are needing a divorce lawyer that will be looking out for you - his client I highly recommend Mr. Smith and his staff.

resp.text: Joyce, thank you very much for the wonderful review. We genuinely appreciate all of the positive feedback.

name: Marsida Cami
text: Reply to Brian Sullivan: Please dont advertise lies about this law firm you told me numerous times how disappointed you were in their services, Mr. Mcghee gave Mr. Sullivan a percentage off his legal fees, if he gave a good review!! False advertisement Really!! My true story: My now ex husband and I went through a chaotic divorce and his lawyer was Mr. McGhee. My experience is based on what I dealt with in phone and email conversations as well as what was told to me by my ex husband and McGhee's  Secretary and how the divorce was handled. First Mr. Mcghee, does not like to speak to people that are "Pro Se" (representing yourself) so even though you worked for over 10 years in the law field as a paralegal and you can easily save your money by doing the settlement and divorce yourself, Shawn McGhee will make sure to give you a hard time. Not only does he lie and says there is a conflict of interest, which is why he won't speak to you which by the way, THAT IS NOT TRUE, but he will not answer any of the calls. For whatever reason he was not able to speak to me which to me seems very unprofessional, he would often have his secretary let me know what was needed for the divorce to be settled. I think because I do know what I needed to do legally, and trust me lawyers hate people that have worked in law fields you cant pull a sheet over legal assistants or paralegals eyes easily, we know all the tricks.  Now his secretary had given me some information that had holes in what she said that included the discovery process and hearings as well as the laws. Because of the communication between me and her and then what she told my ex husband of what I said, which were twisted, this made the divorce messy and long . And I believe the reason was for trial which is very expensive, but lawyers love expensive. Now one thing which is grounds for a grievance is that Mr. McGhee gave advice on the amount of payments for child support that should be paid which is unethical and should only be done by a referee. Mr. Mcghee, has no compassion for children as he informs his clients that they don't need to be responsible parents and pay for the kids until a judge says so, which to me makes me wonder about his character. Being out of state I was not able to do much, and my ex did not even live in Alabama as law requires in order to file but as usual somehow McGhee got around that. I have worked for law firms since I was 16 years old I could never work for someone that does things that are unethical, shady and down right wrong  he has no moral character, and I would be scared if my papers would be questioned by a judge with the amount of lies that my ex and his lawyer gave to me.  Please look at other Law firms that will look at your case and care enough to not control your decisions and won't run up your bill for no reason. Me and my ex husband  managed to settle together without the hearsay talk of his lawyer. The issue I have is there are amazing lawyers out there and Mr. Mcghee is the reason that lawyers have such a bad reputation. Make sure you chose a lawyer that will care about your interests and especially the kids, don't let the kids get lost in the divorce they are the most important thing, don't let the lawyer stress you or the other party or you will cause more harm and extend something that is not good for anyone. And make sure to hold your ground. Research on your lawyer don't chose someone because they are cheap eventually they will show you why they are cheap, Mr. Mcghee was affordable for my ex-husband until hearings and trial came around and then up goes his hourly. Don't be fooled.

resp.text: At Smith & McGhee, we always strive to treat our clients with the utmost of respect and professionalism and we work tirelessly on their behalf. We also recognize that, unfortunately, not every case has a positive outcome, nor do the facts of every case warrant continued legal action. But, we always advise our clients of their best options and remedies. In our continued efforts to address any negative responses to our Google Comments, we have reviewed our client records to try and locate your file. Unfortunately we do not have any records of you being a client of our firm. This leaves us no way to answer your negative review except to assume you may have reviewed the wrong law firm.  If you feel this is in error, please feel free to contact our office at your earliest convenience to discuss any issues or questions you may have.

name: Steve Hallman
text: We recently had the stressful burden of a child support situation change our lives. Involved in a case that had never been before the Alabama Courts, we had no idea if we should fight or roll over and (pay)dead.  I am far from being a quitter but sometimes you feel that there is nothing or no one that can help you and the ones you care for. Sometimes it seems that the Justice system is anything but just. This is exactly how we felt all the way up to our final hearing. We new we were going to need an intelligent and thorough attorney. We researched and asked people who we should use and was referred to Mark. We went and talked with him and he took our case, but told us he couldn't promise anything. He told us that he would do the best he could, and that was all we could ask for. We just wanted what was fair and felt it was worth the fight. After trying to go to court without an attorney and seeing how that was going we just knew we had to have representation. Our finances were extremely tight and we worried that it might just all be for naught. It seemed the law just didn't have anything to protect us. Mark Gober searched and searched and found cases in several other states that supported our side, and gave us some hope. Still we were concerned that it could go either way. We even were concerned that the truth was not going to come out because everyone kept saying that it was all irrelevant. Even with all of the negative things we were hearing  we stuck it out and kept fighting because we felt that it mattered. We wanted our case to maybe help someone else in the future. Mark surpassed anything that we could have expected when we got in the courtroom for our final hearing. We were amazed by how thorough he was without even having to bring every detail into it (which could have taken a lot more time and cost us a whole lot more money). I could not believe it when he actually got them to admit things on the stand that showed exactly what was going on. Justice was truly done as much as it could possibly be thanks to Mark. This was a case for me of right vs. wrong and the good won out. Thank you so much for all that you have done for our family. You are a wonderful attorney and we will definitely tell everyone we know or talk with how hard you worked for us. You went above and beyond, and we now have faith that the Justice system can work.

resp.text: Thank you so much for those kind words. This was most definitely a case of "right vs. wrong" it was my pleasure to work with you and Jennifer.

text: Based on a referral from my old attorney, who recently retired, I selected Mr. Robert Beno to handle my untimely divorce. I found him to be very professional, competent, and affordable even in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic. He got the divorce done in record speed and was very accommodating. He even allowed my now ex to sit in on our consultation upon my request. I hope I never need to be represented again but if I do my first call will be to Mr. Robert Beno, thanks again sir!

name: Dionne Wilson
text: Very professional, proficient and economical. Took the time to explain all things thoroughly and asked if I had any questions every time we met. Also very accommodating to my schedule.

name: Amanda TheGreat
text: Actually you are wrong. I DID show up and paid 200 dollars to you. I came back a second time and you had a whole new quote as to what my service will cost THEN you even asked me to do your footwork I paid you to do. Such as call the courthouse and ask about fees. I went with a much better person as soon as I left your office and just kissed that money goodbye. It was worth it. My whereabouts? What are you even talking about?

name: Trey Horton
text: Went in, Very old guy.... I told him about some tax things I would like to take care of. Paid him $500 - he said he was going to the IRS to pull my transcripts (that can be pulled online) the next day so when I met him next I asked to see them. Since he said he spent all day down there getting them and used the $500 I paid him.. . He could not produce them. Never saw them. I asked him what I needed to do, he offered no sort of plan, no sort of advice. Said let's offer them xyz and see what they say.... Give me a break. I can do that myself...   Never went back. hate being lied to. Lost $500 beware...

name: tom hogan
text: Brad represented me in my divorce. After our initial consultation we communicated primarily through email. I have dealt with attorneys previously in my professional and personal life. I have never had anyone respond as quick as Brad did. He answered any question I had and kept me informed. Additionally, during this all I had a dispute with a business I contracted for some work at our house. The business threaten to place a lien on our house without notice. Brad contacted the business and sent correspondence to them and negotiated a mutual agreeable outcome. I totally recommend Brad Latta!

resp.text: Thank you, Tom! It was great working with you.

name: Jim
text: My family is so grateful to Brad for his kindness and empathy, as we navigated what was best for our aging parents. The situation among my siblings had become unnecessarily complicated, and Brad was able to step in, and immediately turn down the temperature of the situation. We ended up with the best outcome for my folks, and he helped us honor our parents by remaining peaceful. He was very easy to deal with, was incredibly responsive, and I’d highly recommend him for dealing with any family law matter.

name: Alison Slade
text: Brad is an amazing attorney.  He has answered each and every question I have had and has stuck through this process with me, which has taken longer due to the pandemic.  Stephanie is also an amazing part of his team, responding quickly to all my concerns.  There is NO DOUBT I have the right attorney in my corner.  I would highly recommend Brad to anyone needing a great family attorney!

name: Christy Turnipseed
text: Mr. Latta helped me with a serious situation that was also time sensitive so I am greatly appreciative with his quick response and work to help me get my case resolved and won. His staff is also great and very responsive with any questions I had. I hardly ever had to wait for a call back.

name: Tammy Mayfield
text: I cannot say enough good things about Brad Latta! As my divorce attorney in an unusual situation, he helped guide me and represented me well. I highly recommend!

name: Carmen Latner
text: I Highly Recommend Brad Latta and his team. They were very thorough, caring responsive and timely while working on my divorce. Even in the midst of a pandemic they stayed in contact and were working diligently on my case and resolved it the moment the courts reopened. This came after another attorney took my time and money without hesitation. The most competent and best group around.

name: Charlene Cooper
text: Really not sure what to say, because I did most of the talking, he just stood there, lost my case and he helped the other side. Find out he had or having relationship with the other party lawyer. Charge me twice, I have been paying him for over a year and he still say I owe him.

resp.text:
Ms. Cooper - I will be happy to explain the court process again to you if you would like to contact our office.  I assure you that we had your best interests in mind and fought for you as our client.
I'm also happy to send another statement to you as well and explain the billing again.  Please feel free to contact our office if we can help fix this for you. Thank you.

name: Mario Jackson
text: The Latta law firm was extremely professional and very hands on with my case, while presenting my case in court Mr. Brad was very helpful and respectful to me. Anytime I had a question or a problem, Stephanie and the staff had no problem calling, texting, or emailing me a response every time. It took a lil longer than planned, but it was well worth the wait. I can say I'm finally divorced thanks to the Brad J Latta law firm.

text: I had the best, most professional, expediant legal experience ever. My case was handled with care and all of mt questions were answered in a timely manner. Brad and Stephanie are the best!!!!

name: Dina Cheslock
text: I highly recommend Brad for his hard work and tenacity. Not many divorce attorneys out there have any kind of good character but Brad is an exception to that. He is a man of incredible character, is not in it for himself and truly cares about his clients. He does everything in his power to make sure his clients are represented fairly. So grateful for all he did for me and my children.

name: Patricia Pickens
text:
Very disappointed in this attorney as well as his legal assistant.  Mr. Latta came to court in very unprofessional attire, the pants he wore were so wrinkled I was embarrassed for people to know that he was my attorney.  When your paying $250.00 an hour you want you attorney to at least look like he knows what he's doing.  After I complained (which was my right) he withdrew as my attorney (I was going to fire him anyway).  When I requested a copy of me file (which is also my right) and a final invoice his assistant (Allie) was very rude, I could hardly get a word in the conversation, as she talked over me every time I tried to get additional information.  I'm still waiting on a copy of my file and last invoice.  Please save yourself time, money, grief and embarrassment by not using this attorney.
Just received my last invoice from Mr  Latta, after my reviews here and on his FB account.  He has billed me for time he never spent, billed me for a copy of my own file.   Definitely reporting him to the Alabama Bar.

resp.text: Mrs. Pickens had not seen her grandchildren in three months, and left court with them for the weekend due to our work. She thanked me after court, and as has been the case for the past nine years, my suit that day was not wrinkled. My staff was not rude to her the first 50 times she called our office.

name: Amanda Smeraglia
text: Brad Latta is very a very knowledgeable attorney. I have contacted him several times about different matters that concern my daughter and he is always very understanding. He always explains things in a way that is easy for me to understand. I would highly recommend Brad Latta to others.

name: MANDY LANE-Allen
text: Great attorney. Helped my family out with more than one issue. We received an itiemized bill and everything was in order. It’s a shame people done realize that you get billed every time you take up time. Period. This means emails, phone calls to the office, etc. That’s their time and their paralegals time! If you haven’t have personal experience with this firm, then you shouldn’t be leaving a negative review because a “friend” said this and that and whatever. He has been amazing to us and ALL THE FRIENDS WE REFER TO HIM (since we are going to go that route with reviews).

name: Katie Grett
text: Brad was amazing! All my questions were answered when asked, if I asked something of him he would do everything to get it done. I wouldn't want anyone else handling my case in the future!
